Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Data team to the next level üöÄ




1. Team and Role

If you have experience working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©




2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day in Data & Analytics

Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.




3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience in Startup or fast paced environment




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine




5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.




More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!




Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Analizar√°s m√©tricas relativas al tiempo medio de gesti√≥n, costes asociados, frecuencia media y en general cualquier m√©trica que nos ayude a ser m√°s eficientes.

  • Habilidades anal√≠ticas y experiencia en la creaci√≥n de modelos en Excel o Tableau.
  • Grado unviersitario en campos afines al an√°lisis de datos (Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Ingenier√≠a, Inform√°tica, ADE o Econom√≠a).

Ser√≠a fant√°stico si...

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ROLE: Data Analyst

REPORTS TO: Demand Planning Manager

LOCATION: Barcelona Hub

THE ROLE:

The Demand Analyst executes daily task and provide analysis to improve the forecast generated by the system and reduce the amount of manual touches by the demand planner.

Key Success Measures


System Forecast error (MAPE90, MEPE 4-6) ‚Äì measures the forecast error over a specific period.
% Forecast completeness ‚Äì 2-year long range forecast.
System forecast SPP3 ‚Äì evaluates the bias in the 3-month forecast by measuring the deviation from the actual demand over a 3-month period.
System forecast SPP1 ‚Äì evaluates the bias in the 1-month forecast by measuring the deviation from actual demand over a 1-month period.


Core Responsibilities


Maintain and review segmentation in o9: setup parameters, run segmentation job, review segments assignment
Review system forecast output in o9, check largest deviations to detect potential technical or data issues, review Forecast Stability (Cycle on Cycle changes) and the Forecast Completeness, execute necessary corrections as part of monthly process
Ensure correctness of long-term system forecast disaggregation to consensus level and manage critical adjustments
Review output of o9 outlier correction, refine parameters, identify the need for additional manual history cleansing and take corrective actions
Analyze Machine Learning model performance, review impact of forecast drivers, flag driver quality gaps to BU team
Analyze Short-term model accuracy, root cause key gaps and introduce corrective actions
Analyze Long-term model accuracy, root cause key gaps and introduce corrective actions
Generate reports to support business analytics


Continuous Improvement


Use the processes, systems, and tools available to ensure all tasks are value add.
Identify improvement opportunities for the area of responsibility, raising these as appropriate and implementing successfully (where possible).


KEY INTERFACES


Data Scientists
Central Demand planners
Market planners


ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

Degree (or equivalent work experience) in a Supply Chain discipline.


Strong analytical skills.
Knowledge in forecast modeling
Delivering results.
Working to deadlines.
Working as part of a team.
Coding experience is a plus


Our Benefits

Our competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge. As our Demand Planner, some of the benefits you will be entitled to, are:


Flexibility (flexible working time and work from home up to 50%)
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Health insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)
Feedback, verbal offer
Hiring


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive, and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self.

Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Data team to the next level üöÄ




1. Team and Role

If you have experience working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©




2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day in Data & Analytics

Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.




3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience in Startup or fast paced environment




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine




5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.




More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!




Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

HTML:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Data team to the next level üöÄ


1. Team and Role

If you have experience working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©


2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day in Data & Analytics

  • Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
  • Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse using dbt and Airflow.
  • Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
  • Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
  • Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio to communicate results and track KPIs.
  • Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
  • Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
  • Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
  • Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
  • Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
  • Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.


3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

  • Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
  • At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
  • Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
  • Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
  • A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
  • Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

  • A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
  • Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
  • Experience in Startup or fast paced environment


4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

  • Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
  • Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

  • Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
  • Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
  • Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
  • Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
  • Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

  • Organic fruit
  • Free caffeine and theine


5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

  • Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
  • Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
  • Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
  • Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.


More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!


Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!


A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data & Analytics Trainee
Description:
Job Summary

As a Data and Analytics Trainee, you will embark on a journey to dive deep into the world of data science and analytics. This role is designed for individuals who are passionate about leveraging data to drive insights and make informed decisions. You will be part of a dynamic team of data professionals, working closely with experienced data analysts, BI analysts and data engineers to hone your skills and contribute to real-world projects.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

Analytical Support

‚Ä¢Assist in data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing tasks under the guidance of senior team members.

‚Ä¢Learn to navigate and manipulate data using programming languages such as Python or SQL.

‚Ä¢Follow established protocols to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the process.

‚Ä¢Contribute to basic data analysis tasks, such as descriptive statistics, exploratory data analysis, and hypothesis testing.




Visualization and Reporting:

‚Ä¢Assist in creating visualizations and dashboards to communicate data findings effectively.

‚Ä¢Learn to use data visualization tools and libraries to create clear and compelling presentations of analytical results.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python or SQL.
Ability to write and understand basic scripts or queries for data manipulation and analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization principles and techniques.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Power BI or QlikSense.
Clear and effective communication skills, both verbal and written in English (as a multinational company, English will be the primary language of communication in the meetings).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work from Home Policy‚ÄØand‚ÄØWFH Parent Policy: Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).

With 30 years of experience, Altia has proven to be a robust company with a future, innovation capacity, and adaptability.

About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can‚Äôt we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You‚Äôll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will


Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities


You Have


Analytical and data-driven mindset
Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market


Why join us


Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ROLE: Data Analyst

REPORTS TO: Demand Planning Manager

LOCATION: Barcelona Hub

THE ROLE:

The Demand Analyst executes daily task and provide analysis to improve the forecast generated by the system and reduce the amount of manual touches by the demand planner.

Key Success Measures


System Forecast error (MAPE90, MEPE 4-6) ‚Äì measures the forecast error over a specific period.
% Forecast completeness ‚Äì 2-year long range forecast.
System forecast SPP3 ‚Äì evaluates the bias in the 3-month forecast by measuring the deviation from the actual demand over a 3-month period.
System forecast SPP1 ‚Äì evaluates the bias in the 1-month forecast by measuring the deviation from actual demand over a 1-month period.


Core Responsibilities


Maintain and review segmentation in o9: setup parameters, run segmentation job, review segments assignment
Review system forecast output in o9, check largest deviations to detect potential technical or data issues, review Forecast Stability (Cycle on Cycle changes) and the Forecast Completeness, execute necessary corrections as part of monthly process
Ensure correctness of long-term system forecast disaggregation to consensus level and manage critical adjustments
Review output of o9 outlier correction, refine parameters, identify the need for additional manual history cleansing and take corrective actions
Analyze Machine Learning model performance, review impact of forecast drivers, flag driver quality gaps to BU team
Analyze Short-term model accuracy, root cause key gaps and introduce corrective actions
Analyze Long-term model accuracy, root cause key gaps and introduce corrective actions
Generate reports to support business analytics


Continuous Improvement


Use the processes, systems, and tools available to ensure all tasks are value add.
Identify improvement opportunities for the area of responsibility, raising these as appropriate and implementing successfully (where possible).


KEY INTERFACES


Data Scientists
Central Demand planners
Market planners


ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

Degree (or equivalent work experience) in a Supply Chain discipline.


Strong analytical skills.
Knowledge in forecast modeling
Delivering results.
Working to deadlines.
Working as part of a team.
Coding experience is a plus


Our Benefits

Our competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge. As our Demand Planner, some of the benefits you will be entitled to, are:


Flexibility (flexible working time and work from home up to 50%)
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Health insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)
Feedback, verbal offer
Hiring


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive, and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self.

Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!¬†

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.¬†


Key Responsibilities:

Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality.
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives.
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them.
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded.
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.¬†
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues.



Requirements



What will make you stand out from the crowd:

BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.¬†
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments.
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us:

Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off¬†
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!¬†
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget¬†
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities¬†
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean




Sounds good? Apply now!


We're looking forward to getting to know you :)



Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Visualization Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Position Title: Data Visualization Analyst (Remote working)‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Contract: Full-time, Independent Contractor‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Location:‚ÄØ Argentina, Spain, India

Working hours: 40 hours per week, must have approx. 4 hours cross-over with US Eastern Time.

Compensation:‚ÄØAs a remote-first, international firm, compensation is based on candidate experience and location‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

Our Firm:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Sterlington is an international law firm that combines legal and commercial excellence with modern ways of practicing. Our high-caliber partners work on complex business matters with a tailored approach to client service and a focus on financial flexibility and innovation.‚ÄØ

We are the ultimate law firm for private clients, private capital, senior executives, founders, HNWIs and family offices, as well as related businesses, in both corporate and litigation matters. We take a commercial and wholistic approach to the legal and business needs of our clients.‚ÄØ

Learn more at:‚ÄØwww.sterlingtonlaw.com‚ÄØ

The Role:


Develop interactive dashboards and reports in Power BI to facilitate data-driven decision-making‚ÄØ
Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, providing actionable insights to stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to create visualizations that simplify complex datasets and convey key insights
Ability to collaborate with stakeholders in understanding and representing their reporting needs
Design and build interactive dashboards and presentations providing insight to business analyses and trends
Transform complex data into clear, insightful visual formats
Develop visual reporting capabilities tailored to stakeholder requirements


Qualifications:


5-7 years' experience in data visualization tools such as Power BI
Demonstrated ability to create visualizations that simplify complex datasets and convey key insights
Strong Data visualization and presentation background
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.


Sterlington is a full-service law firm that combines legal and commercial excellence with modern ways of practicing.‚ÄØ

This position is not currently open to recruiting agency submissions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are BOB, a hybrid L2 to build and launch Bitcoin applications. Our mission is accelerating the world's transition to a fair and transparent financial system through Bitcoin as a credibly neutral, global settlement asset. We believe in a world with access to finance for everyone, everywhere, in a secure and usable manner.

As a Data Analyst for BOB, you will be leading the quantitative insights to grow and direct decisions at BOB. You are the main person responsible for analysing various on- and off-chain data sources to create and track KPIs and identify trends with a deep product understanding. You will work closely with the product, business, and marketing teams to formulate hypothesis and deliver actionable recommendations focussing on DeFi on BOB.

What You Will Do


Product Metrics and Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on key performance metrics, including channel performance, user activation and retention, TVL, trading volume, and other KPIs
Market Research: Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify emerging trends within the Bitcoin and DeFi ecosystem
Identify DeFi Opportunities: Regularly prepare and update reports about investment opportunities on BOB for our institutional partners
Data Infrastructure: Together with the engineering team, design and build foundational data systems, including ETLs, dashboards, and analytics that drive data-driven decision-making and support scalable business growth



Requirements


Proven ability to lead complex analytical projects from concept to completion, especially in web3 environments
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python through your experience as business or data analyst or other quant-related position
Deep understanding of DeFi, including protocols, block explorers, and data sources
Eagerness to improve products through fast experimentation, A/B testing, and a data-driven approach
Enjoy working in a results-driven and fast-paced startup environment



Benefits


Research-oriented team
Solve novel problems
Stock options
Remote working
30-day vacation
Allowance for a co-working space
Yearly retreat

Title: Data Analyst, Finance
Description:
Headquartered in Basel, Straumann is a global leader in implant and restorative dentistry and oral tissue regeneration.

Having pioneered many of the most influential technologies and techniques in our field, we have a tradition of doing more to advance dental regeneration, restoration and replacement, as well as patient care. Straumann partners with passionate people who fit in with the agile dynamics of our size-for-success company. People at Straumann appreciate the opportunity to shape our future and create impact. Encouraging leadership and inspiring ideas from our people has guided us through our proud history of pioneering innovations.

About The Role

Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive impactful business decisions? Do you enjoy working at the intersection of finance and digital transformation? As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in the Group Reporting team, empowering our global Finance organization with cutting-edge reporting solutions.

This newly created position is part of our initiative to strengthen our team with digital capabilities, focusing on automating and enhancing our Finance reporting processes. Working in a matrix environment within a multinational company operating in over 100 countries, you will be instrumental in advancing our digital transformation agenda.

Key Responsibilities


Build and Optimize Dashboards: Create and maintain Power BI dashboards and data models to provide actionable insights.
Subject Matter Expertise: Become the go-to expert for the Finance BI platform within the Group Reporting team.
Innovate Digital Services: Build and improve digital reporting platform services, driving efficiency and user adoption.
Enhance Data Workflows: Partner with the Data + Tech team to define, maintain, and improve data pipelines and processes.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with Finance stakeholders worldwide to understand their needs and deliver self-service reporting solutions.
Align with Data Strategy: Partner with the Data + Tech team to ensure alignment with the company‚Äôs global data strategies.


Experience

What We‚Äôre Looking For:


2+ years of hands-on experience in developing reporting and analytics solutions using Power BI (or similar tools).
Proven experience collaborating with diverse stakeholders to define requirements and extract value from data.
Expertise in building and managing ETL data flows and data pipelines is an asset.
Exposure to BI consulting or similar client-facing roles is a plus.


Skills


Strong proficiency in Power BI, including data visualization and DAX. You are capable of independently creating and assembling dashboards from start to finish. SQL knowledge is a plus.
Knowledge of data modeling principles, including the ability to design business-oriented data structures.
Experience with ETL tools and understanding of data integration processes is beneficial.
Innovative thinker with a passion for solving technical and business challenges.
Effective communicator capable of working with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


What We Offer


A key role in shaping the digital transformation of Finance within a multinational organization.
Opportunities to collaborate with diverse, global teams across Finance and Technology.
A collaborative, forward-thinking work environment in Madrid, where our company serves as a key hub for global functions and innovation.
Competitive compensation and professional growth opportunities.


Ready to shape the future of Finance reporting with us?

Apply today to join our team and bring your expertise in data engineering and reporting to a global stage.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

Title: Data & Analytics Trainee
Description:
Job Summary

As a Data and Analytics Trainee, you will embark on a journey to dive deep into the world of data science and analytics. This role is designed for individuals who are passionate about leveraging data to drive insights and make informed decisions. You will be part of a dynamic team of data professionals, working closely with experienced data analysts, BI analysts and data engineers to hone your skills and contribute to real-world projects.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

Analytical Support

‚Ä¢Assist in data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing tasks under the guidance of senior team members.

‚Ä¢Learn to navigate and manipulate data using programming languages such as Python or SQL.

‚Ä¢Follow established protocols to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the process.

‚Ä¢Contribute to basic data analysis tasks, such as descriptive statistics, exploratory data analysis, and hypothesis testing.




Visualization and Reporting:

‚Ä¢Assist in creating visualizations and dashboards to communicate data findings effectively.

‚Ä¢Learn to use data visualization tools and libraries to create clear and compelling presentations of analytical results.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python or SQL.
Ability to write and understand basic scripts or queries for data manipulation and analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization principles and techniques.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Power BI or QlikSense.
Clear and effective communication skills, both verbal and written in English (as a multinational company, English will be the primary language of communication in the meetings).

FUNCIONES

Title: Internship Business Intelligence
Description:
Description:

At Johnson & Johnson,‚ÄØwe believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a‚ÄØworld where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured,‚ÄØwhere treatments are smarter and less invasive, and‚ÄØsolutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

What you will do:


Support in create and update reports to analize our performance in the markets we opperate inclunding sales, market shares, share of Voice, patient shares, etc..
Support in sales force excellence analisys (Frequency, potentials, target, indicator, etc..) of our account managers.
Learn about market research: Initiates key relationships with market research agencys and help BI team to developing market research .Assists in the planning of market research studies and budget control.
Learn to identify opportunities with regional partners, customers, Johnson and Johnson brands, and alliances. Develops significant familiarity with marketing plans, products, vendors, and sales contacts.
Coordinates with other functions to monitor and analyse market trends
Report all suspected adverse reactions, serious or non serious, I may be aware of within a maximum of 24 hours after being aware of it and communicate it to the Pharmacovigilance Department.


We offer:


One year internship.
1000 euros/month
Full time
Start date - March


Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing or similar; or Bachelor's Degree in Science with high interest in data and analytical skills.
Important Knowledge: Excel and ppt.
Fluent English.


DE&I Statement

For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) has been a part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Rooted in Our Credo, the values of DEI fuel our pursuit to create a healthier, more equitable world. Our diverse workforce and culture of belonging accelerate innovation to solve the world‚Äôs most pressing healthcare challenges.

We know that the success of our business ‚Äì and our ability to deliver meaningful solutions ‚Äì depends on how well we understand and meet the diverse needs of the communities we serve. Which is why we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging where all perspectives, abilities and experiences are valued and our people can reach their potential.

At Johnson & Johnson, we all belong.

Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell




Banco Sabadell es una de las principales entidades bancarias en Espa√±a con m√°s de 14.000 personas caracterizadas por nuestra implicaci√≥n, esp√≠ritu de colaboraci√≥n y dinamismo. ¬°√önete a nosotros!




¬øQu√© estamos buscando?




Actualmente buscamos un perfil proactivo y con iniciativa, que tenga curiosidad y clara orientaci√≥n a la resoluci√≥n de problemas, con capacidad anal√≠tica y de auto-organizaci√≥n y que sepa trabajar en equipo.

Los modelos de riesgos evolucionan cada d√≠a gracias al aumento en la disponibilidad y capacidad de an√°lisis de datos, permitiendo el desarrollo de nuevas herramientas cuantitativas √∫tiles para la gesti√≥n y toma de decisiones. Esto, junto con las m√∫ltiples exigencias regulatorias sobre el sector bancario, hace que exista una amplia variedad de tareas que requieren un alto grado de implicaci√≥n por su complejidad.




La Direcci√≥n de Modelos de Riesgo tiene como misi√≥n dar soporte a las diversas √°reas encargadas de la modelizaci√≥n del riesgo de cr√©dito en Banco Sabadell participando transversalmente de forma activa en los diversos procesos dentro del ciclo de vida de un modelo (an√°lisis de datos, modelizaci√≥n, validaci√≥n, implantaci√≥n y seguimiento), principalmente en la construcci√≥n de las herramientas de calificaci√≥n (rating/scoring) y en la estimaci√≥n de los par√°metros de riesgo (PD, LGD y EAD) para el c√°lculo de capital y provisiones del Grupo Banco Sabadell.

Estimaci√≥n y backtest de los modelos internos de PD (Probability of Default), EAD (Exposure At Default), LGD (Loss Given Default) y otros par√°metros para provisiones (IFRS9), para capital regulatorio (IRB) y para planificaci√≥n financiera (Stress Test, ICAAP).
Desarrollo, aplicaci√≥n y seguimiento una vez implementados.
Assessment de compliance con est√°ndares de Banco Sabadell y los requerimientos regulatorios.
Documentaci√≥n modelos y estimaciones para uso en Banco Sabadell.




Dar√°s soporte en auditor√≠as y validaciones tanto internas como externas (supervisor, auditores externos).




Har√°s mantenimiento y desarrollo de las BBDD:




Controles de calidad de datos y conocimiento del proceso.
Planteo de requerimientos a IT y validaci√≥n de la implementaci√≥n de los mismos.




¬øQu√© valoramos de tu candidatura?




Que tengas estudios superiores en Econom√≠a, Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Actuariales, F√≠sica o Ingenier√≠a Superior.




Valoraremos formaci√≥n complementaria (Master o Postgrado) con componente cuantitativo y/o acreditaciones como FRM, CQF, Certificaciones en Data Analytics, Modelling, Machine Learning o similar.




Experiencia m√≠nima de 1-2 a√±os en funciones vinculadas a modelos de riesgo de cr√©dito (desarrollo, control, seguimiento, coordinaci√≥n, validaci√≥n, auditor√≠a), en sector Banca.




Que est√©s habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gesti√≥n de informaci√≥n, an√°lisis de BBDD y elaboraci√≥n de informes, con conocimiento del entorno regulatorio y normativa aplicable a riesgo de cr√©dito.




Que conozcas con suficiencia lenguajes de programaci√≥n estad√≠stica (SAS - SQL), as√≠ como dominio del paquete Office. Valoraremos conocimientos de otros lenguajes de programaci√≥n (Phyton, R) y herramientas de BI (Power BI).




Que aportes un buen nivel de Ingl√©s (m√≠nimo B2).







Banco Sabadell est√° comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selecci√≥n, formaci√≥n y promoci√≥n ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminaci√≥n por motivo de g√©nero, edad, orientaci√≥n sexual, religi√≥n, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About The Job

Every time we eat and drink, we choose the world we want to live in. We believe that the health of people and the planet are 100% interconnected. This is what our One Planet One Health vision conveys. We invite you to join our food revolution with the goal of creating a healthier world.

Are you passionate about IT&DATA? Join our BTheOne Program and start your journey at Danone!

Your main objectives will be the following


Work on real-world projects that provide practical experience and deepen your expertise in data analytics tools such as SQL, excel, powerbi, and python.
Gather and structure data from various sources, collect, prepare, and understand data, and present clear information.
Contribute to the improvement of data quality and support the delivery of data products.
Develop solutions to specific challenges that are compliant with our data quality framework and collaborate with internal data teams.
Utilize powerpoint skills to report results to relevant stakeholders and communicate effectively with them.
Collaborate with professionals around the world and gain insights and guidance from experienced data leads.


About you

Do not hesitate to apply if...


In your studies, you‚Äôve focused on Business Analytics, Data Analytics , IT, or Software Engineering
You‚Äôre familiar with Office 365 programs, and have a strong interest in product development
You have experience with SQL, and it‚Äôs a plus if you have skills with one or more of the following technologies SAP, Python, Snowflake, Informatica, MS PowerBI
You have strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual capabilities
You have a high level of English
And above all... you are looking forward to learning in a multinational company like Danone üôÇ


About us

Working at Danone gives you the opportunity to impact more than 12 million consumers in Spain, where we lead the ranking of the most chosen brands in the country.

At Danone you will work to make a vision a reality ‚ÄúOne Planet, One Health‚Äù and it doesn't matter where you are to make an impact on it.

Here, you will have space to create, to undertake, to grow and above all to be yourself, thanks to our culture of Inclusive Diversity, where we are clear that ‚Äúour differences are what make the difference‚Äù.

You will work with agile methodologies, in high performance teams where you will learn, influence and contribute to achieve specific goals and grow with the company.

We want you to come and see for yourself, but if you want more information first, click here to convince you danoneespana.es / @danonecareers_es

At Danone we are 100% committed to guaranteeing selection processes free of bias and equal opportunities. For this we have trained all the people who participate in them. Because to work with us, what matters to us is what you can contribute and nothing else.

HTML:
About The Job

Every time we eat and drink, we choose the world we want to live in. We believe that the health of people and the planet are 100% interconnected. This is what our One Planet One Health vision conveys. We invite you to join our food revolution with the goal of creating a healthier world.

Are you passionate about IT&DATA? Join our BTheOne Program and start your journey at Danone!

Your main objectives will be the following

  • Work on real-world projects that provide practical experience and deepen your expertise in data analytics tools such as SQL, excel, powerbi, and python.
  • Gather and structure data from various sources, collect, prepare, and understand data, and present clear information.
  • Contribute to the improvement of data quality and support the delivery of data products.
  • Develop solutions to specific challenges that are compliant with our data quality framework and collaborate with internal data teams.
  • Utilize powerpoint skills to report results to relevant stakeholders and communicate effectively with them.
  • Collaborate with professionals around the world and gain insights and guidance from experienced data leads.

About you

Do not hesitate to apply if...

  • In your studies, you‚Äôve focused on Business Analytics, Data Analytics , IT, or Software Engineering
  • You‚Äôre familiar with Office 365 programs, and have a strong interest in product development
  • You have experience with SQL, and it‚Äôs a plus if you have skills with one or more of the following technologies SAP, Python, Snowflake, Informatica, MS PowerBI
  • You have strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual capabilities
  • You have a high level of English
  • And above all... you are looking forward to learning in a multinational company like Danone üôÇ

About us

Working at Danone gives you the opportunity to impact more than 12 million consumers in Spain, where we lead the ranking of the most chosen brands in the country.

At Danone you will work to make a vision a reality ‚ÄúOne Planet, One Health‚Äù and it doesn't matter where you are to make an impact on it.

Here, you will have space to create, to undertake, to grow and above all to be yourself, thanks to our culture of Inclusive Diversity, where we are clear that ‚Äúour differences are what make the difference‚Äù.

You will work with agile methodologies, in high performance teams where you will learn, influence and contribute to achieve specific goals and grow with the company.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data Analyst Intern (Revenue)
Description:
About Ukio |

Ukio's mission is to empower individuals to live where they want, when they want üåé.

We do this by disrupting the traditional residential real estate market, providing fully furnished and artfully designed apartments for stays starting at one month. We remove all the hassle around finding a rental with no long-term contracts, moving/buying furniture, security deposits, broker fees, etc. giving choice and flexibility to allow people to live where and when they want. üí•

We are a Barcelona based startup with offices in Madrid, Lisbon, Berlin and Paris! and soon we will conquer some more cities across Europe üöÄ

Backed by Europe's best Venture Capital firms, the next year will be a critical phase in our growth as we look to further build out our team and expand into multiple new markets üî• . We have successfully raised a Series A investment round that will help propel our growth throughout Western Europe. ü•á

Our Culture |

We honor diversity, compassion, and honesty above all else in our team. We've already got a great mix of dedicated, collaborative, and results-driven people and are looking for more like minded folks to join our team. In true startup fashion, we always embrace the unknown and grant full autonomy to our team members to act as the owners of their projects and tasks. We are creators who embrace dynamic environments and take on and build up projects from scratch.

Our team is composed of everyone from foodies to athletes, adventure seekers to art buffs. We know fun, and we always have a team event on our calendars, so are you ready to join us?

Role |

We are looking for a Revenue Analyst Intern to join our Revenue team and help us analyze all data from existing and new markets. The Revenue team is Ukio¬¥s control tower for all business operations, responsible for optimizing Ukio¬¥s pricing strategy as well as driving meaningful growth for all distribution channels. Every year we will expand into multiple new markets while continuing to optimize our existing portfolio.

You will be supporting the analytics team with the creation and analysis of different reports. To succeed in this role you will need to take initiative, manage your own projects, communicate clearly with other teams and strive to understand what drives our business.

Responsibilities |


Act as a bridge connecting our data output to the business users who depend on it. Grasp their goals and discover creative approaches to assist in achieving them efficiently.
Utilize your expertise in SQL to construct effective queries that transform raw data into easily digestible and valuable insights, transform in dashboards for easy visualization of stakeholders
Empower users across the organization by helping them to better understand our data structure and how to extract the most value out of it
Comprehend the processes of our business needs and proactively devise strategies to automate existing manual tasks


About you |


An undergraduate or graduate degree with a technology / mathematics / economics major or minor; or the successful completion of a technical bootcamp
A visualization enthusiast with a keen eye for detail and a talent for crafting compelling presentations tailored for technical and non-technical stakeholders
High level of English and Spanish
SQL knowledge and interest
Excellent Analytical Skills
High level of Excel and good knowledge of Office
Time management and organization skills
Ability to work in teams
Flexible, resilient and content with ambiguity and changes.
Confident with working in cross-functional teams
Comfortable performing in a start-up environment.


Ukio's life benefits |


A challenging job at one of the fastest growing companies in Europe
International working environment with many different nationalities
Work with talented, committed and supportive teammates
Flexible schedule and no dress code!
Team events and an amazing internal culture
Breakfast in the office, fruits, nutrition bars, free coffee and popcorn for whenever you feel like it!


Ukio's culture promotes and values each individual's contribution. Diversity and inclusion, it's a big topic for us, as such we encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief.

Sky's the limit for us. We're here to revolutionize your life. Be part of this revolution üî•

We look forward to receiving your application!

For more information about Ukio, visit us at www.ukio.com and to keep up to date with UKIO's news, follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram!

Title: ESG Analyst
Description:
En Damm desarrollamos nuestra actividad con un estilo propio que conecta con las personas y el entorno y que apuesta por el cuidado del medio ambiente. La sostenibilidad es un elemento esencial para la compa√±√≠a que empieza por el compromiso con las personas de nuestro equipo.

El equipo de RSC de Damm est√° creciendo y ofrecemos dos vacantes con sede en Barcelona para las personas que desean ser parte del cambio y dejar un impacto positivo.

DESCRIPCI√ìN DE LA POSICI√ìN ‚Äì ESG ANALYST

Trabajar√°s en un entorno multidisciplinar en el √°mbito de la sostenibilidad, fomentando relaciones duraderas y de confianza con todos los stakeholders tanto internos como externos.
Coordinar√°s y har√°s seguimiento de los indicadores de seguimiento (KPIs) del Plan ESG.
Analizar√°s la evoluci√≥n de los diferentes datos de informaci√≥n no financiera de la organizaci√≥n.
Coordinar√°s la recogida de informaci√≥n para el Reporting corporativo de informaci√≥n no financiera.
Gestionar√°s y liderar√°s la implementaci√≥n del software para la gesti√≥n de la informaci√≥n no financiera
Realizar√°s evaluaciones de doble materialidad, identificaci√≥n de riesgos e impactos de sostenibilidad en planes de acci√≥n.
Co-crear√°s proyectos de impacto social y medioambiental, desde el dise√±o hasta la implementaci√≥n.
Responder√°s los cuestionarios de requerimientos por parte de clientes y proveedores entorno la materia de ESG




EXPERIENCIA DESEADA

M√≠nimo de 2 -3 a√±os de experiencia laboral relevante en posiciones similares o de consultor√≠a de sostenibilidad.
Experiencia comprobada en la resoluci√≥n de desaf√≠os en organizaciones que ejecutan proyectos y programas de sostenibilidad.
Experiencia comprobada en el desarrollo de estrategias de sostenibilidad, planes de acci√≥n, evaluaciones de materialidad, participaci√≥n y di√°logo con los stakeholders y an√°lisis de la cadena de valor/suministro.
Experiencia comprobada en gesti√≥n de proyectos, conocimiento de procesos y habilidades de planificaci√≥n.




FORMACI√ìN DESEADA / RECOMENDADA

Licenciatura/grado en un campo relevante -preferiblemente en ADE y/o Derecho y y/o Ciencias Ambientales-.
Se valorar√° MBA o MSc (MSc in Sustainability Management o similar) y toda la formaci√≥n adicional en ESG / RSC / Sostenibilidad que se pueda demostrar.
Alto nivel de ingl√©s
Alto dominio del paquete Office: Excel, Word y Power Point.




APTITUDES ESPERADAS

Buscamos una persona profesional comprometida y sensibilizada con las personas, la sociedad y el medioambiente:

Alta capacidad de organizaci√≥n
Alta capacidad para recopilar, procesar y analizar datos
Facilidad en la interpretaci√≥n de los datos para su transformaci√≥n en informaci√≥n relevante para la compa√±√≠a
Clara orientaci√≥n a resultados
Atenci√≥n al detalle
Facilidad para la colaboraci√≥n interdepartamental y trabajo en equipo
Actitud positiva, proactiva y din√°mica
Clara vocaci√≥n y/o sensibilidad hacia la sostenibilidad, las personas y la RSC




OTRAS CONSIDERACIONES




La naturaleza de la posici√≥n requiere flexibilidad, disposici√≥n para viajar y la posibilidad de trabajar algunos fines de semana en fechas puntuales.




ACERCA DE DAMM




En Damm "unimos la pasi√≥n por nuestros productos y por el territorio para mejorar los momentos de disfrute de las personas." Este es nuestro prop√≥sito, que se basa en cinco conceptos que captan nuestra esencia.

Formar parte de Damm significa integrar un estilo de vida basado en los valores: #LIVE (Loyalty, Innovation, Customer Value y Energy) y creemos en lo que hacemos. ¬øQuieres formar parte de nuestra historia? ¬°√önete a nuestro equipo!

  • Experiencia comprobada en gesti√≥n de proyectos, conocimiento de procesos y habilidades de planificaci√≥n.


FORMACI√ìN DESEADA / RECOMENDADA

  • Licenciatura/grado en un campo relevante -preferiblemente en ADE y/o Derecho y y/o Ciencias Ambientales-.
  • Se valorar√° MBA o MSc (MSc in Sustainability Management o similar) y toda la formaci√≥n adicional en ESG / RSC / Sostenibilidad que se pueda demostrar.
  • Alto nivel de ingl√©s
  • Alto dominio del paquete Office: Excel, Word y Power Point.


APTITUDES ESPERADAS

Buscamos una persona profesional comprometida y sensibilizada con las personas, la sociedad y el medioambiente:

  • Alta capacidad de organizaci√≥n
  • Alta capacidad para recopilar, procesar y analizar datos
  • Facilidad en la interpretaci√≥n de los datos para su transformaci√≥n en informaci√≥n relevante para la compa√±√≠a

  • Atenci√≥n al detalle

  • Clara vocaci√≥n y/o sensibilidad hacia la sostenibilidad, las personas y la RSC


OTRAS CONSIDERACIONES


La naturaleza de la posici√≥n requiere flexibilidad, disposici√≥n para viajar y la posibilidad de trabajar algunos fines de semana en fechas puntuales.


ACERCA DE DAMM


En Damm "unimos la pasi√≥n por nuestros productos y por el territorio para mejorar los momentos de disfrute de las personas." Este es nuestro prop√≥sito, que se basa en cinco conceptos que captan nuestra esencia.
