Title: Data Analyst I (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Join our team and become an integral part of Glovo's Global Logistics! We provide a dynamic and challenging environment filled with numerous opportunities for growth and development.

Support the optimization of the most important logistics feature, the courier payments engine, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness. The KPIs you will influence are crucial to operations, as every decision made will directly affect the whole operational investment (biggest company cost).

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will


Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs operations.
Develop analytical frameworks and models, while effectively communicating with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams
Dive deep into data to identify key factors and actions to improve KPIs, taking accountability for outcomes.
Explore and find the most optimal logistics payment structure in order to maximize global couriers engagement
Support the operational courier payments engine migration (key project for the company)
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Provide analytical support to the logistics team for more than 22 countries, regional and local teams throughout deeper understanding of Glovo's operations model


YOU HAVE


Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or similar
+1 year of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Python and experience working with analysis tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Scikit, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R is highly valued
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Strong strategic vision and business mindset
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About This Role

Gartner RESSO(Research Engagement Services Strategy and Operations) is looking for a Data Analytics who has a passion for analytical problem solving to be part of our growing team. This individual will solve a wide range of problems related to content analytics, and interaction analytics, demand sensing, staffing models, cost reporting, automation, standard reporting, and ad-hoc analytics. Individuals in this role will work closely with RESSO leadership to structure problems, identify data sources, perform analysis, and communicate findings. Strong performers will build skills to independently own project workstreams and interact with stakeholders. Projects will include a mix of team problem solving and independent problem solving. Some projects will also involve automation and collaboration with the Information Technology team.

What You‚Äôll Do


Partner with RESSO colleagues to do analysis that surfaces actionable insight for the RES organization. Effectively communicate findings to drive adoption and implementation.
Project ownership: Contribute to key projects like RES service level analytics, associate performance analytics, etc.
Leads the development of custom Power BI dashboards, interactive deliverables, and innovative prototypes to enhance asset team and delivery consultant productivity gains.
Develop and maintain custom build SQL queries as the Power BI report data source and address ad-hoc analytics requests.
Domain expertise: Become a deep subject-matter expert on Gartner‚Äôs data, analytic tools, reports & data infrastructure. Take responsibility for problem solving, root cause analysis, and devising testing methodologies for validation and articulately explaining data sources to senior audiences.
Continuous improvement: Support and enable improvement initiatives related both to RESSO deliverables (e.g. new data products, innovative data sources, analytic insights, tools) as well as operational process improvement (e.g. improving RESSO processes and communications).


What You‚Äôll Need


Experience: 3-4 years of experience involving analysis of large volumes of data with strong hands-on experience with analytical tools. Ability to gather, analyze, restructure, identify and articulate insights from qualitative and quantitative data Ability to creatively design the user experience of data visualizations, dashboards, and reports leveraging Power BI
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, preferably with a quantitative concentration (e.g., statistics, data science, mathematics, engineering, operational research, computer science, or economics)
Exceptional problem solving: Proven track record of solving complex problems, thinking creatively, and using data to tell a story.
Communication: excellent written and verbal communication skills with the desire to share technical knowledge and information with others.
Technical competency: Strong expertise in SQL for data access and transformation. implementing Reporting, BI, Visualization and Analytics tools in Power BI
Strong organizational skills within a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
A curious and inquisitive mind, with an openness to new experiences and learning


Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

Job Requisition ID:97388

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

Title: Data Analysis Internship
Description:
Our opportunity

Life is too short to just tick the box. Reimagine the box with Zurich!

Would you like to be part of a trainee program that helps you gain experience with newest technologies and build up the business knowhow in one of the biggest insurers in the world?

During this experience not only you will learn and boost your career but also you will build relationships and have fun with teams all over the world!

With us you will have a real opportunity to make a difference and be part of the team!

Your role

Are you enthusiastic about data analysis? Do you enjoy working with learning & development data? Do you excel in dynamic environments where your contributions can truly make a difference? If so, we have an exciting opportunity waiting for you!

As our Data Analysis Intern, you will have the chance to:


Assist in the crucial tasks of data cleaning and preparation to ensure our learning & development data is accurate and ready for analysis.
Utilize your advanced Excel skills to perform in-depth analysis and derive actionable insights from complex datasets.
Design and develop compelling Power BI dashboards that vividly illustrate key trends and metrics.
Play an essential role in the ongoing updates and maintenance of our data, ensuring its reliability and relevance.
Take the lead on a small data automation project, showcasing your ability to innovate and streamline our data processes.


Your Skills And Experience

We would like to give this opportunity to somebody who is:


Skilled in Data Analytics Tools & Techniques, and Data Modeling.
Has knowledge in Python, DAX, or/ and R
Proficient in Excel and Power BI
Experienced with Automation
Active student status with Spanish University/School is mandatory
University student interested in developing career in tech field
Looking for at least 9 months part-time/internship program
Tech savvy approach
An enthusiastic, capable, curious person craving to learn
A good team player with responsible and can-do attitude
Able to use English for daily communication with colleagues and managers from abroad


Additional Information

We offer benefits such as:


Paid Internship
Option to work remotely within Spain
Up to 30 hs weekly with Flexible schedule
LinkedIn, Coursera and internal training opportunities
Special discounts on different brands and products & great banking and insurance conditions.
Welcome pack that includes amazing gadgets.
A cool workspace with gaming, gym, and fun area!
A variety of clubs for you to get to know your colleagues and have fun, e.g. hiking, skiing, reading and many others!
Free coffee and fruit at the office.


Primary work location is Barcelona Poblenou.

Does it look like you have found your future job? Don‚Äôt wait anymore and apply sending your CV in English!

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

You are the heart & soul of Zurich!

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We highly value the experience and know-how of our employees and offer a wide range of opportunities across business areas to encourage you to apply for new opportunities within Zurich when you are ready for your next career step.

Let‚Äôs continue to grow together!


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working:
Schedule: Part Time
Recruiter name: Alba Marin Sola

Title: Internship, Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst Intern for our dynamic market Intelligence team.

Responsibilities


Search for opportunities for business development and increase of company's market share in different services
Regular analysis of the company's performance
Convert the information into knowledge in order to increase company's competitiveness
Develop and maintain regulatory databases
Create, update and organize database of potential international customers
Support regional teams across the globe
Attend meetings with sales and business development managers based internationally


Qualifications


Degree in Business Administration / Data Analysis / Economics/ International Business.
Knowledge in Big Data a plus.
Fluent in English, Intermediate in Spanish.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft windows applications (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)
MI tools such as Power Bi, MACRO, Data Scrapping tools are preferred.
Able to communicate effectively at all levels.
Willing to learn.
Proactive, organized, and multitasking with great team spirit.
Mission: At UL, we know why we come to work. Shape the way we approach and deliver our solutions to have a meaningful contribution to society.
People: Be part of our global team and do your best work! Teamwork, open-feedback and our diversity are our drivers to reach our common mission.
Interesting work: The work that goes on inside UL is fuelling the future. It challenges you to try fresh approaches, work autonomously, drive change and gain in-depth experience in your field.
Grow & achieve: Growth and development are part of our DNA. Grow & achieve with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as your very own UL University.
This is our normal: Competitive remuneration, annual bonus, flexible hours, home office options, paid annual leave.


About Us

A global leader in applied safety science, UL Solutions (NYSE: ULS) transforms safety, security and sustainability challenges into opportunities for customers in more than 110 countries. UL Solutions delivers testing, inspection and certification services, together with software products and advisory offerings, that support our customers‚Äô product innovation and business growth. The UL Mark serves as a recognized symbol of trust in our customers‚Äô products and reflects an unwavering commitment to advancing our safety mission. We help our customers innovate, launch new products and services, navigate global markets and complex supply chains, and grow sustainably and responsibly into the future. Our science is your advantage.

Title: Data Analyst with Python
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with proven experience in Python, SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our Data Science Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!

The role is based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:


Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product¬¥s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue. Have one¬¥s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance


Skills and requirements:


+2 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Strong knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query)
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus


Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:


Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning
Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Ticket Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28 countries
And more!

Title: Middle Data Analyst
Description:
Volkswagen Group Services is excited to present a fantastic opportunity to join our Volkswagen Digital:Hub in Spain. As part of the global Software Development Centre network in the Volkswagen Group, we constantly seek talented individuals ready to bring their unique skills to our projects.

Our start-up environment is collaborative, innovative, and open to new ideas. We strive to cultivate a work culture that encourages individual growth, team empowerment, and project excellence. We value respect, teamwork, and the common purpose that binds us as a group. If you're ready to thrive in a dynamic start-up environment and be part of our family, supported by one of the largest companies in the world, we invite you to read further.

About the Team and the Hub:


Our culture is centered around fostering individual growth and team empowerment within a flexible and supportive environment.
We prioritize respect, teamwork, and inclusivity, recognizing and valuing the unique contributions of each member.
We embrace a work-life balance philosophy and encourage continuous personal and professional development.


The Role:


We are looking for a Data Analyst who excels at using Tableau and other data visualization tools to turn complex datasets into clear, actionable insights. In this role, you will be responsible for building efficient data models, optimizing performance, and creating engaging dashboards. While familiarity with QlikView is a plus (our legacy system is built on QlikView), it is not a strict requirement.


Key Responsibilities:


Data Visualization & Reporting:
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards primarily in Tableau.
Translate data findings into visually appealing presentations and reports for stakeholders.
Data Modeling & Optimization:
Design, build, and maintain effective data models.
Implement optimization techniques to ensure data accuracy and performance.
Collaborate with data engineering teams to maintain data quality across databases.
Analysis & Insights:
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and actionable insights.
Provide regular and ad-hoc reports to support business decisions and strategies.
Recommend improvements based on data findings and business needs.
Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement:
Partner with product, marketing, and operations teams to understand data requirements.
Offer recommendations on best practices in data usage and interpretation.
Communicate complex analytical concepts to non-technical audiences.


Requirements:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
2+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or similar analytical role.
Fluent in Spanish and English
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in Tableau (development, deployment, troubleshooting).
Experience with SQL and relational databases for data extraction and manipulation.
Understanding of data modeling concepts, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.
Knowledge of performance tuning and optimization best practices.
Experience with other BI tools such as QlikView (legacy environment) is a plus, but not required.
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication abilities.
Attention to detail and commitment to data integrity.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment.


What we offer:


Hybrid work, with an option to work from home some days per week.
Access to professional development tools and free language courses.
Flexible working hours to accommodate personal and professional needs.
A competitive holiday package and access to a variety of employee discounts.


Join us at Volkswagen Digital:Hub to advance your career in a role where your administrative skills will directly contribute to the success and smooth operation of our innovative projects.

For more information on our data processing activities and your rights as a data subject, please consult our privacy policy.

HTML:
Volkswagen Group Services is excited to present a fantastic opportunity to join our Volkswagen Digital:Hub in Spain. As part of the global Software Development Centre network in the Volkswagen Group, we constantly seek talented individuals ready to bring their unique skills to our projects.

Our start-up environment is collaborative, innovative, and open to new ideas. We strive to cultivate a work culture that encourages individual growth, team empowerment, and project excellence. We value respect, teamwork, and the common purpose that binds us as a group. If you're ready to thrive in a dynamic start-up environment and be part of our family, supported by one of the largest companies in the world, we invite you to read further.

About the Team and the Hub:

  • Our culture is centered around fostering individual growth and team empowerment within a flexible and supportive environment.
  • We prioritize respect, teamwork, and inclusivity, recognizing and valuing the unique contributions of each member.
  • We embrace a work-life balance philosophy and encourage continuous personal and professional development.

The Role:

  • We are looking for a Data Analyst who excels at using Tableau and other data visualization tools to turn complex datasets into clear, actionable insights. In this role, you will be responsible for building efficient data models, optimizing performance, and creating engaging dashboards. While familiarity with QlikView is a plus (our legacy system is built on QlikView), it is not a strict requirement.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Data Visualization & Reporting:
  • Develop and maintain interactive dashboards primarily in Tableau.
  • Translate data findings into visually appealing presentations and reports for stakeholders.
  • Data Modeling & Optimization:
  • Design, build, and maintain effective data models.
  • Implement optimization techniques to ensure data accuracy and performance.
  • Collaborate with data engineering teams to maintain data quality across databases.
  • Analysis & Insights:
  • Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and actionable insights.
  • Provide regular and ad-hoc reports to support business decisions and strategies.
  • Recommend improvements based on data findings and business needs.
  • Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement:
  • Partner with product, marketing, and operations teams to understand data requirements.
  • Offer recommendations on best practices in data usage and interpretation.
  • Communicate complex analytical concepts to non-technical audiences.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
  • 2+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or similar analytical role.
  • Fluent in Spanish and English
  • Technical Skills:
  • Proficiency in Tableau (development, deployment, troubleshooting).
  • Experience with SQL and relational databases for data extraction and manipulation.
  • Understanding of data modeling concepts, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.
  • Knowledge of performance tuning and optimization best practices.
  • Experience with other BI tools such as QlikView (legacy environment) is a plus, but not required.
  • Soft Skills:
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication abilities.
  • Attention to detail and commitment to data integrity.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment.

What we offer:

  • Hybrid work, with an option to work from home some days per week.
  • Access to professional development tools and free language courses.
  • Flexible working hours to accommodate personal and professional needs.
  • A competitive holiday package and access to a variety of employee discounts.

Join us at Volkswagen Digital:Hub to advance your career in a role where your administrative skills will directly contribute to the success and smooth operation of our innovative projects.

For more information on our data processing activities and your rights as a data subject, please consult our privacy policy.

Ref: Level C

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can‚Äôt we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You‚Äôll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will


Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities


You Have


Analytical and data-driven mindset
Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market


Why join us


Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ROLE: Data Analyst

REPORTS TO: Demand Planning Manager

LOCATION: Barcelona Hub

THE ROLE:

The Demand Analyst executes daily task and provide analysis to improve the forecast generated by the system and reduce the amount of manual touches by the demand planner.

Key Success Measures


System Forecast error (MAPE90, MEPE 4-6) ‚Äì measures the forecast error over a specific period.
% Forecast completeness ‚Äì 2-year long range forecast.
System forecast SPP3 ‚Äì evaluates the bias in the 3-month forecast by measuring the deviation from the actual demand over a 3-month period.
System forecast SPP1 ‚Äì evaluates the bias in the 1-month forecast by measuring the deviation from actual demand over a 1-month period.


Core Responsibilities


Maintain and review segmentation in o9: setup parameters, run segmentation job, review segments assignment
Review system forecast output in o9, check largest deviations to detect potential technical or data issues, review Forecast Stability (Cycle on Cycle changes) and the Forecast Completeness, execute necessary corrections as part of monthly process
Ensure correctness of long-term system forecast disaggregation to consensus level and manage critical adjustments
Review output of o9 outlier correction, refine parameters, identify the need for additional manual history cleansing and take corrective actions
Analyze Machine Learning model performance, review impact of forecast drivers, flag driver quality gaps to BU team
Analyze Short-term model accuracy, root cause key gaps and introduce corrective actions
Analyze Long-term model accuracy, root cause key gaps and introduce corrective actions
Generate reports to support business analytics


Continuous Improvement


Use the processes, systems, and tools available to ensure all tasks are value add.
Identify improvement opportunities for the area of responsibility, raising these as appropriate and implementing successfully (where possible).


KEY INTERFACES


Data Scientists
Central Demand planners
Market planners


ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

Degree (or equivalent work experience) in a Supply Chain discipline.


Strong analytical skills.
Knowledge in forecast modeling
Delivering results.
Working to deadlines.
Working as part of a team.
Coding experience is a plus


Our Benefits

Our competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge. As our Demand Planner, some of the benefits you will be entitled to, are:


Flexibility (flexible working time and work from home up to 50%)
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Health insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)
Feedback, verbal offer
Hiring


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive, and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self.

Join us in making over the world of beauty!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!¬†

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.¬†


Key Responsibilities:

Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality.
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives.
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them.
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded.
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.¬†
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues.



Requirements



What will make you stand out from the crowd:

BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.¬†
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments.
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us:

Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off¬†
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!¬†
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget¬†
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities¬†
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean




Sounds good? Apply now!


We're looking forward to getting to know you :)



Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Visualization Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Position Title: Data Visualization Analyst (Remote working)‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Contract: Full-time, Independent Contractor‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Location:‚ÄØ Argentina, Spain, India

Working hours: 40 hours per week, must have approx. 4 hours cross-over with US Eastern Time.

Compensation:‚ÄØAs a remote-first, international firm, compensation is based on candidate experience and location‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

Our Firm:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Sterlington is an international law firm that combines legal and commercial excellence with modern ways of practicing. Our high-caliber partners work on complex business matters with a tailored approach to client service and a focus on financial flexibility and innovation.‚ÄØ

We are the ultimate law firm for private clients, private capital, senior executives, founders, HNWIs and family offices, as well as related businesses, in both corporate and litigation matters. We take a commercial and wholistic approach to the legal and business needs of our clients.‚ÄØ

Learn more at:‚ÄØwww.sterlingtonlaw.com‚ÄØ

The Role:


Develop interactive dashboards and reports in Power BI to facilitate data-driven decision-making‚ÄØ
Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, providing actionable insights to stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to create visualizations that simplify complex datasets and convey key insights
Ability to collaborate with stakeholders in understanding and representing their reporting needs
Design and build interactive dashboards and presentations providing insight to business analyses and trends
Transform complex data into clear, insightful visual formats
Develop visual reporting capabilities tailored to stakeholder requirements


Qualifications:


5-7 years' experience in data visualization tools such as Power BI
Demonstrated ability to create visualizations that simplify complex datasets and convey key insights
Strong Data visualization and presentation background
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.


Sterlington is a full-service law firm that combines legal and commercial excellence with modern ways of practicing.‚ÄØ

This position is not currently open to recruiting agency submissions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are BOB, a hybrid L2 to build and launch Bitcoin applications. Our mission is accelerating the world's transition to a fair and transparent financial system through Bitcoin as a credibly neutral, global settlement asset. We believe in a world with access to finance for everyone, everywhere, in a secure and usable manner.

As a Data Analyst for BOB, you will be leading the quantitative insights to grow and direct decisions at BOB. You are the main person responsible for analysing various on- and off-chain data sources to create and track KPIs and identify trends with a deep product understanding. You will work closely with the product, business, and marketing teams to formulate hypothesis and deliver actionable recommendations focussing on DeFi on BOB.

What You Will Do


Product Metrics and Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on key performance metrics, including channel performance, user activation and retention, TVL, trading volume, and other KPIs
Market Research: Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify emerging trends within the Bitcoin and DeFi ecosystem
Identify DeFi Opportunities: Regularly prepare and update reports about investment opportunities on BOB for our institutional partners
Data Infrastructure: Together with the engineering team, design and build foundational data systems, including ETLs, dashboards, and analytics that drive data-driven decision-making and support scalable business growth



Requirements


Proven ability to lead complex analytical projects from concept to completion, especially in web3 environments
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python through your experience as business or data analyst or other quant-related position
Deep understanding of DeFi, including protocols, block explorers, and data sources
Eagerness to improve products through fast experimentation, A/B testing, and a data-driven approach
Enjoy working in a results-driven and fast-paced startup environment



Benefits


Research-oriented team
Solve novel problems
Stock options
Remote working
30-day vacation
Allowance for a co-working space
Yearly retreat
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Finance
Description:
Headquartered in Basel, Straumann is a global leader in implant and restorative dentistry and oral tissue regeneration.

Having pioneered many of the most influential technologies and techniques in our field, we have a tradition of doing more to advance dental regeneration, restoration and replacement, as well as patient care. Straumann partners with passionate people who fit in with the agile dynamics of our size-for-success company. People at Straumann appreciate the opportunity to shape our future and create impact. Encouraging leadership and inspiring ideas from our people has guided us through our proud history of pioneering innovations.

About The Role

Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive impactful business decisions? Do you enjoy working at the intersection of finance and digital transformation? As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in the Group Reporting team, empowering our global Finance organization with cutting-edge reporting solutions.

This newly created position is part of our initiative to strengthen our team with digital capabilities, focusing on automating and enhancing our Finance reporting processes. Working in a matrix environment within a multinational company operating in over 100 countries, you will be instrumental in advancing our digital transformation agenda.

Key Responsibilities


Build and Optimize Dashboards: Create and maintain Power BI dashboards and data models to provide actionable insights.
Subject Matter Expertise: Become the go-to expert for the Finance BI platform within the Group Reporting team.
Innovate Digital Services: Build and improve digital reporting platform services, driving efficiency and user adoption.
Enhance Data Workflows: Partner with the Data + Tech team to define, maintain, and improve data pipelines and processes.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with Finance stakeholders worldwide to understand their needs and deliver self-service reporting solutions.
Align with Data Strategy: Partner with the Data + Tech team to ensure alignment with the company‚Äôs global data strategies.


Experience

What We‚Äôre Looking For:


2+ years of hands-on experience in developing reporting and analytics solutions using Power BI (or similar tools).
Proven experience collaborating with diverse stakeholders to define requirements and extract value from data.
Expertise in building and managing ETL data flows and data pipelines is an asset.
Exposure to BI consulting or similar client-facing roles is a plus.


Skills


Strong proficiency in Power BI, including data visualization and DAX. You are capable of independently creating and assembling dashboards from start to finish. SQL knowledge is a plus.
Knowledge of data modeling principles, including the ability to design business-oriented data structures.
Experience with ETL tools and understanding of data integration processes is beneficial.
Innovative thinker with a passion for solving technical and business challenges.
Effective communicator capable of working with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


What We Offer


A key role in shaping the digital transformation of Finance within a multinational organization.
Opportunities to collaborate with diverse, global teams across Finance and Technology.
A collaborative, forward-thinking work environment in Madrid, where our company serves as a key hub for global functions and innovation.
Competitive compensation and professional growth opportunities.


Ready to shape the future of Finance reporting with us?

Apply today to join our team and bring your expertise in data engineering and reporting to a global stage.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

16604

Key Responsibilities

  • Build and Optimize Dashboards: Create and maintain Power BI dashboards and data models to provide actionable insights.
  • Subject Matter Expertise: Become the go-to expert for the Finance BI platform within the Group Reporting team.
  • Innovate Digital Services: Build and improve digital reporting platform services, driving efficiency and user adoption.
  • Enhance Data Workflows: Partner with the Data + Tech team to define, maintain, and improve data pipelines and processes.
  • Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with Finance stakeholders worldwide to understand their needs and deliver self-service reporting solutions.
  • Align with Data Strategy: Partner with the Data + Tech team to ensure alignment with the company‚Äôs global data strategies.

Experience

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

  • 2+ years of hands-on experience in developing reporting and analytics solutions using Power BI (or similar tools).
  • Proven experience collaborating with diverse stakeholders to define requirements and extract value from data.
  • Expertise in building and managing ETL data flows and data pipelines is an asset.
  • Exposure to BI consulting or similar client-facing roles is a plus.

Skills

  • Strong proficiency in Power BI, including data visualization and DAX. You are capable of independently creating and assembling dashboards from start to finish. SQL knowledge is a plus.
  • Knowledge of data modeling principles, including the ability to design business-oriented data structures.
  • Experience with ETL tools and understanding of data integration processes is beneficial.
  • Innovative thinker with a passion for solving technical and business challenges.
  • Effective communicator capable of working with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

What We Offer

  • A key role in shaping the digital transformation of Finance within a multinational organization.
  • Opportunities to collaborate with diverse, global teams across Finance and Technology.
  • A collaborative, forward-thinking work environment in Madrid, where our company serves as a key hub for global functions and innovation.
  • Competitive compensation and professional growth opportunities.

Ready to shape the future of Finance reporting with us?

Apply today to join our team and bring your expertise in data engineering and reporting to a global stage.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

16604

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
At Gopuff, we‚Äôre not just delivering convenience‚Äîwe‚Äôre redefining how the world shops. Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we‚Äôve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

Now, we‚Äôre building something even bigger. We‚Äôre establishing a core hub in Lisbon, Portugal and we‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst to shape the future of quick commerce.

This is not just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs a mission. As a Lead Data Analyst, you‚Äôll own the transformation of raw data into game-changing insights, fuelling the decisions that drive our business forward.

You‚Äôll partner with cross-functional teams, challenge the status quo and make high-impact recommendations that influence company-wide KPIs. With your mastery of SQL, Python and advanced analytics, you won‚Äôt just support decisions‚Äîyou‚Äôll lead them.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance‚Äîjust a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you‚Äôre a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let‚Äôs go. üöÄ

You Will:


Analyse and enhance key metrics across customer acquisition, retention, and revenue generation to drive business efficiency, optimise cost-effectiveness, and elevate customer satisfaction.
Develop and maintain advanced data models using dbt to deliver transparency and clarity into core business performance metrics, ensuring alignment with strategic KPIs.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams‚Äîincluding Category Management, Growth, and Finance‚Äîto translate data insights into actionable strategies that improve processes and drive measurable outcomes.
Conduct deep dives into company performance to identify areas for improvement, uncover opportunities for efficiency, and ensure KPIs align with overarching business objectives.
Solve complex, real-world challenges by leveraging data to deliver practical solutions that enhance operational excellence and fuel company growth.
Present data insights in a clear and compelling manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring decisions are informed by robust analysis.


You Have:


Proven Data Analytics Expertise: 3-5 years of hands-on experience in data analytics, ideally in a fast-paced, high-growth e-commerce or retail environment, where you‚Äôve delivered impactful insights that drive business success.
Fluency in English: Exceptional communication skills in English, enabling you to effectively collaborate with global teams and present complex data insights to diverse audiences.
Outstanding Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in SQL, Python, Looker, and dbt, with a proven track record of querying large datasets, building complex reports, and developing scalable data models that empower decision-making.
Mastery of Data Visualisation and Reporting Tools: Deep familiarity with tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI, with a talent for transforming raw data into strategic insights and actionable recommendations.
Analytical Problem-Solver: A natural problem-solver with a passion for tackling complex business challenges, identifying opportunities for improvement, and delivering innovative, data-driven solutions.
High-Performing and Self-Motivated: A self-starter who thrives in dynamic environments, consistently pushing boundaries to deliver excellence and make a tangible impact on the business.
Strong Communicator: Ability to present data insights clearly and persuasively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including leadership.


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it‚Äîstuff happens. But that‚Äôs where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we‚Äôre assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you‚Äôre hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2‚Äì4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in Information Technology and Computer Science or Mathematics and Statistics
Up to 2 years of relevant experience in Data Analytics
Fluent (C1-C2) level of English
Ability to synthetize / simplify
Good communication skills (both oral and written)
Ability to deliver / results driven
Skills in Business Analytics
Skills in IT
Analytical ability, namely in Tableau, Power BI, PowerQuery and Microsoft SQL Server


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Information Technology and Computer Science or Mathematics and Statistics
  • Up to 2 years of relevant experience in Data Analytics
  • Fluent (C1-C2) level of English
  • Ability to synthetize / simplify
  • Good communication skills (both oral and written)
  • Ability to deliver / results driven
  • Skills in Business Analytics
  • Skills in IT
  • Analytical ability, namely in Tableau, Power BI, PowerQuery and Microsoft SQL Server

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Product

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale‚Äôs use Tabby‚Äôs technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

You‚Äôll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:


Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:


3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.
Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data ‚Äî extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple‚Äôs ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google‚Äôs Privacy Sandbox.
Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Fluency in English.



Job Benefits:


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
Health Insurance.



Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:


Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ComparaJ√°.pt

ComparaJ√°.pt is a free and independent online comparison platform for financial services and products, with a clear mission: to help people saving time and money, in a quick and simple comparison tool.

Our goal is for Portuguese consumers to make informed and conscious financial decisions. For this, we provide a free, impartial, thorough and independent platform, where people can compare the various financial providers in the Portuguese market for home loans, personal loans, credit cards, telecommunication and energy providers, life insurance and saving accounts.

We are the #1 personal finance platform in Portugal for the users, our partners and media channels. We are part of Samlino Group, a European Investment Company that helps Europeans save time and money by making better choices about insurance, home services and banking products. In Europe, our sister companies are: Samlino.dk (Denmark), VertaaEnsin.fi (Finland), TopCompare.be & Tariefchecker.be (Belgium), and Pricefox.gr (Greece).

What You'll Do


You will support expansion and daily operations, analyzing marketing trends and participating in strategic projects.
You will be responsible and have full ownership of analytical work, with direct reporting to one of our Managing Directors.
You will collaborate with the different Marketing Teams (SEO, PR, paid social, Search), Product and Operational teams, being the point of contact for the key projects you are leading.
You will cooperate within a multicultural and multidisciplinary team developing and improving processes, with direct contact with the Group leadership team in London.


What We Expect from you

You possess an unparalleled work ethic with a high sense of urgency. You have a relentless drive and desire to be the very best at what you do. You take ownership of everything you do, are proactive and follow through on commitments. Moreover, you're humble and you share our passion for building and executing new businesses. Furthermore, we expect that you:


Have acquired a bachelor or master's degree with outstanding results in Management, Marketing, Economics, Finance or another related field. Financial knowledge is a plus.
You are knowledgeable in MS Office and analytical tools. SQL knowledge is a plus.
You have a strong sense of ownership and initiative and a genuine interest in learning and act on the desire.
You have a strong affinity for critical thinking, analytical, hands-on execution, problem-solving, and result-orientation.
You have an EU work permit.
Plus: You are passionate about Marketing and Management, with a taste for Finance.


What We Offer


A workplace with great talents and leaders that will inspire and challenge you daily.
Responsibility for high impact projects that constantly push you out of your comfort zone and give you the opportunity to be the best you can.
Competitive compensation and benefits.
Assume responsibility and decision-making authority from your first day.
Work on exciting and challenging projects and create an impact with new, innovative ideas.
Grow personally and professionally from working both independently and as part of an international group.
Work with and learn from experts and mentors in diverse fields.
Create strong and meaningful connections with your team members at exciting company events.
Be part of one of the most promising Portuguese fintech startups, with one goal in mind: help the Portuguese people saving money.
Show more

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Intern
Description:
Join our team at AMGEN Capability Center Portugal, number 1 company in Best WorkplacesTM https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ ranking in Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. We have a team of over 300 talented people and more than 35 different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance, General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city centre, our AMGEN office fosters innovation, excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in people‚Äôs lives.

BUSINESS, DATA ANALYTICS AND INSIGHTS INTERN

LIVE

What You Will Do

Let‚Äôs do this. Let‚Äôs change the world. In this vital role you will support the delivery of the day to day D&A activities. You will assist in producing budgeting and planning reports, data analysis, as well as supporting process improvement projects with the D&A team.

Other responsibilities will include:


Supporting business planning and decision making through financial analysis.
Calculating scenarios based of expectations.
Collecting feedback and preparing communication plans to share outputs.
Taking ownership of complex calculations through understanding inputs and their relationships to the problem.
Understanding, preparing and analyzing ad hoc reports.
Develop new and existing data models that are tailored to create insights about the sales of Amgen‚Äôs products.
Learn, provide support and training on the internal CRM system.
Using reporting and data visualization tools (Tableau) to develop new and maintain existing reporting dashboards and to deliver insight and drive action for the affiliate teams.
Support on capacity calculation and territories.
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities by leveraging technologies.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a team player with customer focus. You are problem solving, result oriented and have proven analytical- and process management skills.

Required experience and skills:


University Degree in engineering, data analytics, management, mathematics, computer science, business intelligence or related field.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel knowledge
Desire to learn and apply your university studies in the industry.


Preferred Knowledge:


Working knowledge of IS systems, such as MS Office applications, SQL, Tableau,.
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude, and desire to learn.
Familiarity of the Pharmaceutical industry.
Ability to synthesize information and generate suggestions for improvement.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us

As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates‚Äô professional and personal growth and well-being.


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

CAREERS.AMGEN.COM

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
Show more
