Preferred Knowledge:

  • Working knowledge of IS systems, such as MS Office applications, SQL, Tableau,.
  • Demonstrates a service-minded attitude, and desire to learn.
  • Familiarity of the Pharmaceutical industry.
  • Ability to synthesize information and generate suggestions for improvement.

THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us

As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, so we work to care for our teammates‚Äô professional and personal growth and well-being.

  • Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
  • Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
  • Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
  • Flexible work arrangements.

APPLY NOW

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

CAREERS.AMGEN.COM

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Product Data Analyst ‚Äì Digital Channels
Description:
Country: Portugal

Localiza√ß√£o: Lisboa

Descri√ß√£o Geral da Fun√ß√£o

We are looking for an experienced and data-driven Product Data Analyst to join our Digital Channels team. This role focuses on leveraging data to inform and optimize product decisions, ensuring our web and app platforms deliver outstanding customer experiences. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and a strong analytical background, helping the team with product discovery, business case development, A/B testing, and the continuous monitoring of key features through dashboards and reporting tools.

Principais Responsabilidades


User interaction Analysis: Analyze web and app usage data to uncover trends, user behavior, and opportunities for product improvement.
Product Discovery Support: Collaborate with Product Managers during the discovery phase by providing insights from data to identify customer needs and validate opportunities.
Business Case Development: Contribute to the development of business cases by providing data-driven insights and projections to evaluate potential product initiatives.
Success Metrics Definition: Partner with stakeholders to define and track key success metrics for new features and initiatives, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to validate hypotheses, measure impact, and optimize product performance.
Dashboard Creation: Develop and maintain dashboards for continuous monitoring of key features, ensuring stakeholders have real-time insights into performance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making throughout the product lifecycle.
Tool Optimization: Act as a subject matter expert in Google Analytics 4, ensuring best practices are followed and providing training or guidance to team members as needed.


Requisitos


Experience: 2-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a fintech, digital product, or SaaS environment.
Analytics Expertise: Strong hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and familiarity with other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI).
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Data Storytelling: Ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights and present findings effectively to stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving complex problems using data.
A/B Testing: Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product hypotheses and feature performance.
Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics), Economics, Marketing, Business or a related discipline.

Title: STDA Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Stress Testing Data Analytics (STDA) team has a key role to play in the development of a strong risk management framework for the BNP Paribas Group. The team is responsible for the elaboration of the dataset that will be used as the starting point for modelling activities and stress testing exercises, which are crucial in granting the Group means to anticipate risks
The team works on a Big Data environment, with access to an ecosystem of Hadoop tools including Spark and Hive. Dataiku DSS (Data Science Studio) is used as an end-user interface, providing a visual approach to the implementation of ETL (Extract Transform Load) pipelines. Data visualization is also a part of the team‚Äôs responsibilities, with Tableau as the main tool
The team works in partnership with the IT department of the Group regarding the stress-testing platform. They support the team on a daily-basis and help with back-end big data engineering support and maintenance
In this role, you will join the team dedicated to credit risk. Your primary responsibility will be to handle big data, perform in-depth data analysis, present data to see beyond the numbers and prepare the databases used for the projection of credit risk parameters for stress testing and IFRS 9


Your Main Activities Are


Perform data collection and build/maintain reliable data pipelines
Work on data ingestion, data quality, data preparation, data cleaning and data analysis
Perform data consolidation in a strong control and analyses framework
Build and optimize the data processing, being in charge of sourcing and connecting data
Develop dynamic and intelligent dashboards
Work closely with our data providers and with our clients
Specific contributions to regulatory and internal stress testing exercises


Profile and Skills to Success


Master Degree Information Technology / Computer Science or related
Up to 2 years of experience in Information Technology / Data Analytics or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Python
Standard SQL
Tableau
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Analytical ability
Ability to develop and adapt a process

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission? Making day-to-day banking easier for SMEs and freelancers thanks to an online business account that's combined with invoicing, bookkeeping and spend management tools. Thanks to its innovative product, highly reactive 24/7 customer support and clear pricing, Qonto has become the leader in its market.

Our journey: Founded by Alexandre and Steve in July 2017, Qonto has rapidly gained trust, serving over 500,000 customers. Thanks to our wonderful team of 1,600+ Qontoers, we also made it to the LinkedIn Top Companies French ranking!

Our values:

Customer focus | Prioritize customers in everything you do

Ownership | Own your part, get things done

Teamwork | Make (team)work easy

Mastery | Continuously raise the bar

Integrity | Always do what‚Äôs right, and respect people

Our beliefs: At Qonto, we're committed to fostering a welcoming environment where everyone can thrive. We prioritize evaluating applicants based solely on skills and potential, ensuring diversity with 50% international team members, 44% women, and 20% parents. Join us in building a workplace that celebrates diversity and individuality.

Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process .

Growth Data Analyst

Shape the Future of European Business Banking

Transform raw data into growth strategies that impact businesses across Europe

Our Mission:

At Qonto, we're revolutionizing business banking for SMEs and freelancers across Europe. Data isn't just numbers to us - it's the cornerstone of our decision-making and the fuel for our rapid growth. As our Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be at the intersection of data and business strategy, directly influencing how we expand our footprint in the European market.

üë©‚Äçüíªüßë‚ÄçüíªYour Impact:

Join our team of data analysts where you'll:


Drive Qonto's expansion strategy through data-driven insights
Uncover growth opportunities that could impact thousands of businesses
Partner with stakeholders across Spain, France, Serbia, and Germany to shape our European success story.
Be part of a dynamic BI organization that's central to Qonto's strategic decisions


üéØ Your Key Missions:


Strategic Performance Monitoring: Design and implement sophisticated monitoring systems that track our growth trajectory and spot opportunities
Growth Detective: Lead investigations into performance patterns, transforming data anomalies into actionable acquisition strategies
Analytics Democratization: Create intuitive self-service analytics tools that empower our growth team to make data-driven decisions
Strategic Partnership: Be the trusted data advisor to our growth department, challenging assumptions and driving data-informed strategies
Quality Champion: Help set new standards for analytics excellence, ensuring our insights are both powerful and reliable


üë• The Team Experience:


Work alongside a diverse, international team of five growth experts spread across Europe
Learn from various experience levels, including staff members and senior analysts
Enjoy a culture that values autonomy, quick learning, and strong relationships
Tackle exciting challenges that require creative problem-solving and innovative thinking


ü§ù Your Future Manager: Omar

Meet Omar, our Lead Data Analyst who:


Built Qonto's analytics team from 4 to 25 talented individuals
Brings rich experience from airline revenue management and ad tech industries
Is passionate about mentoring and developing data talent
Will help you grow both technically and strategically in your role


üèÖ What Makes You Stand Out:


Analytical Prowess: You have a proven track record in growth analytics, particularly in areas like onboarding or website analytics
Business Acumen: You don't just crunch numbers - you understand the business implications behind them
Technical Excellence: You're proficient in Python, SQL, and Tableau, with an eagerness to expand your technical toolkit
Communication: You can translate complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations
Innovation Mindset: You're excited about finding creative solutions to complex data challenges
Statistical Thinking: You can distinguish meaningful patterns from statistical noise


‚ôüÔ∏è Why This Role Matters:


Direct impact on Qonto's European expansion strategy
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge analytics tools and methodologies
Chance to shape the future of business banking
Work in a fast-growing scale-up that values data-driven decision-making


Diversity & Inclusion:

At Qonto, diversity isn't a checkbox - it's our strength. We believe the best teams are built on different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. We encourage applications from everyone who feels they can contribute to our mission, regardless of traditional qualifications.

üèÜ What We Offer:


Work with a purpose: Help transform business banking across Europe
Growth opportunities: Learn from experienced data leaders and tackle complex challenges
International exposure: Collaborate with teams across multiple European markets
Innovation culture: Be part of a team that's pushing the boundaries of fintech


At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

üéÅ Perks

A tailor-made and dynamic career track. An inclusive work environment. And so much more to help you succeed.


Offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, Barcelona, and Belgrade;
Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for and where you live;
Competitive salary package;
A meal voucher;
Public transportation reimbursement (part or global);
A great health insurance (depending on the country);
Employee well-being initiatives: access to Moka Care to take care of your mental health and great offers for sports and wellness activities;
A progressive disability and parenthood policy (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners;
Monthly team events.


üí™ Our hiring process:


Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like


We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average, our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours ü§û

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog | Les √âchos I L'Usine Digitale | Courrier Cadres

To know how your personal data will be processed during your application process or to request its deletion, please click here .

Title: Trainee Data Analyst (Career Accelerator with Employment Guarantee)
Description:
Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving informed decision-making? Are you looking for a structured training program that can kickstart your career in data analysis?

At Nuyew Tech Academy, we specialise in providing aspiring tech professionals like you with the tools, training, and support needed to launch successful careers in this vital industry.

Whether you're starting from scratch or looking to advance your existing skills, our academy offers a comprehensive program designed to cultivate your talent and propel you towards exciting opportunities in data analysis.

What the Data Analysis Career Accelerator at Nuyew Tech Academy includes and what students can expect:


Comprehensive Training: Receive in-depth training in data analysis tools and techniques, including Excel, Databases, Python, Power BI and AI.
Hands-on Experience: Opportunities to gain practical experience through real-world scenarios and virtual labs.
Industry-Recognised Certifications: Preparation for industry-recognised certifications such as CompTIA Data+, Microsoft Power BI Associate and Microsoft Excel Expert to validate skills and enhance employability.
Personalised Support: Dedicated student support team offering guidance, feedback, and support throughout the program to ensure student success.
Career Development: Tailored career guidance, resume building, interview preparation, and job search assistance to help students transition into data analyst roles.
Networking Opportunities: Access to networking events and alumni connections to expand professional networks and explore career opportunities.
Financial Support: Scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans available to make the program accessible and affordable for all aspiring data analyst professionals.


Requirements


No previous experience or qualifications required
Strong interest in tech and data analysis
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Detail-oriented and strong attention to accuracy and completeness
Willingness to learn and continuously improve technical and professional skills


Benefits


Career Advancement: Elevate your professional journey with a tailored training course that's designed to set you on the path towards high-demand tech roles.
Competitive Salary Prospects: Upon completing our training and gaining some relevant experience, candidates are poised to secure roles with salaries aligned to what's advertised on the job listing. Invest in your future potential!
Employment Guarantee: If you haven't secured a tech job by course completion, we'll provide additional training and career support until you do. Still not employed after three years? We'll refund your tuition in full, and you keep your certifications. Your future in tech starts with us.
Professional Growth: Broaden your horizons and skill set with diverse professional development opportunities throughout and post-training.
Dynamic Learning Environment: Experience a vibrant and supportive academy atmosphere where innovation meets education.
Affordable Learning: We're committed to making education accessible. The academy career pathway tuition fee of ¬£3995 can be funded by scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans which enable you to spread your tuition fee over 36 months.


Please Note: While we offer robust training and support to help candidates find employment, it's important to clarify that candidates will not be directly employed by Nuyew Tech Academy. Our commitment is to empower you with the skills and support needed to enhance your job prospects in the broader tech industry.


Show more
HTML:
Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving informed decision-making? Are you looking for a structured training program that can kickstart your career in data analysis?

At Nuyew Tech Academy, we specialise in providing aspiring tech professionals like you with the tools, training, and support needed to launch successful careers in this vital industry.

Whether you're starting from scratch or looking to advance your existing skills, our academy offers a comprehensive program designed to cultivate your talent and propel you towards exciting opportunities in data analysis.

What the Data Analysis Career Accelerator at Nuyew Tech Academy includes and what students can expect:

  • Comprehensive Training: Receive in-depth training in data analysis tools and techniques, including Excel, Databases, Python, Power BI and AI.
  • Hands-on Experience: Opportunities to gain practical experience through real-world scenarios and virtual labs.
  • Industry-Recognised Certifications: Preparation for industry-recognised certifications such as CompTIA Data+, Microsoft Power BI Associate and Microsoft Excel Expert to validate skills and enhance employability.
  • Personalised Support: Dedicated student support team offering guidance, feedback, and support throughout the program to ensure student success.
  • Career Development: Tailored career guidance, resume building, interview preparation, and job search assistance to help students transition into data analyst roles.
  • Networking Opportunities: Access to networking events and alumni connections to expand professional networks and explore career opportunities.
  • Financial Support: Scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans available to make the program accessible and affordable for all aspiring data analyst professionals.

Requirements

  • No previous experience or qualifications required
  • Strong interest in tech and data analysis
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • Detail-oriented and strong attention to accuracy and completeness
  • Willingness to learn and continuously improve technical and professional skills

Benefits

  • Career Advancement: Elevate your professional journey with a tailored training course that's designed to set you on the path towards high-demand tech roles.
  • Competitive Salary Prospects: Upon completing our training and gaining some relevant experience, candidates are poised to secure roles with salaries aligned to what's advertised on the job listing. Invest in your future potential!
  • Employment Guarantee: If you haven't secured a tech job by course completion, we'll provide additional training and career support until you do. Still not employed after three years? We'll refund your tuition in full, and you keep your certifications. Your future in tech starts with us.
  • Professional Growth: Broaden your horizons and skill set with diverse professional development opportunities throughout and post-training.
  • Dynamic Learning Environment: Experience a vibrant and supportive academy atmosphere where innovation meets education.
  • Affordable Learning: We're committed to making education accessible. The academy career pathway tuition fee of ¬£3995 can be funded by scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans which enable you to spread your tuition fee over 36 months.

Please Note: While we offer robust training and support to help candidates find employment, it's important to clarify that candidates will not be directly employed by Nuyew Tech Academy. Our commitment is to empower you with the skills and support needed to enhance your job prospects in the broader tech industry.

Title: Financial Data Analyst
Description:
What do we do?

Paddle offers digital product companies a completely different approach to their payment infrastructure. Instead of assembling and maintaining a complex stack of payments-related apps and services, we‚Äôre a Merchant of Record for our customers. That means we take away 100% of the pain of payment fragmentation. It‚Äôs faster, safer, cheaper, and, above all, way better.

We‚Äôre backed by investors including KKR, FTV Capital, Kindred, Notion, and 83North and serve over 5000 software sellers in 245 territories globally.

The Role:

Working closely with Paddle‚Äôs finance team, the core of the role will be supporting the Finance Operations Manager in making sure all financial data is accurate and available in real time.

As Paddle is scaling we‚Äôre constantly developing and delivering new products for our customers, as well rapidly growing the number of transactions through our platform each month globally. In order to maintain high standards in financial reporting, these changes in products and increase in transactions must be monitored closely, and the reporting accurately reflected.

The Analyst will be responsible for creating, maintaining, and improving a series of reports across accounting, tax and treasury, as well as supporting the team through annual audits, and providing data analysis and insight for key stakeholders within the company. They will be able to utilise our data stack and work with our Data Engineering team to ensure the Finance team‚Äôs needs are met and the quality of, and access to, our reporting is high.

The role will be fast paced and can include changing priorities due to the team‚Äôs needs.

What you'll do:


Work closely with the Finance teams to produce and maintain a series of key reports needed for Paddle‚Äôs financial reporting
Work on scoped briefs under the guidance of the Finance Operations Manager and other Finance Managers
Be able to build, and work with Data Engineering to build out the reporting infrastructure across our BI tools and data stack
Become a subject matter expert on Paddle financial data, and the tools we use.
Contribute to strategic planning by recognising areas of weakness or upcoming change, and efficiency improvements in our reporting across:
Global tax filings
Month end reporting across sales and revenue
Continually evolve our data collection, processing and reporting structures through scoping new tools and methods to help the Finance team support the wider business


We'd love to hear from you:


You have strong commercial experience in relational database structures, SQL, and Excel.
Experience with Pigment is a plus.
Working knowledge of Dbt and Snowflake is a plus.
You have experience working within a financial organisation or with finance teams
You have experience working with large data sets
You‚Äôre a great problem solver
You have strong data visualisation and presentation techniques.
You have exposure to BI and ETL tools, such as Sisense, Looker, Tableau and PowerBI.
Have experience in working for start ups / scale ups, or financial organisations, and can work in an unstructured environment


Everyone is welcome at Paddle

At Paddle, we‚Äôre committed to removing invisible barriers, both for our customers and within our own teams. We recognise and celebrate that every Paddler is unique and we welcome every individual perspective. As an inclusive employer, we don‚Äôt care if, or where, you studied, what you look like or where you‚Äôre from. We‚Äôre more interested in your craft, curiosity, passion for learning and what you‚Äôll add to our culture. We encourage you to apply even if you don‚Äôt match every part of the job ad, especially if you‚Äôre part of an underrepresented group.

Please let us know if there‚Äôs anything we can do to better support you through the application process and in the workplace. We will do everything we can to support any accommodations needed. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse team where everyone feels safe to be their authentic self. Let‚Äôs grow together.

Why you‚Äôll love working at Paddle

We are a diverse, growing group of Paddlers across the globe who pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative and respectful culture.

We live and breathe our values, which are:

Paddle For Others

Paddle together

Paddle simply

We offer a full suite of benefits, including attractive salaries, stock options, retirement plans, private healthcare and well-being initiatives.

We are a ‚Äòdigital-first‚Äô company, which means you can work remotely, from one of our stylish hubs, or even a bit of both! We offer all team members unlimited holidays and enhanced parental leave. We invest in learning and will help you with your personal development via constant exposure to new challenges, an annual learning fund, and regular internal and external training.

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
üè∑Ô∏èTitle: Product Analyst

üë´Department: RevOps

üìçLocation: UK or Europe, Remote

About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences. Our diverse team drives innovation, using deep industry expertise and an extensive network to empower the next wave of blockchain-driven companies. At Block Labs, we‚Äôre passionate about turning bold ideas into breakthrough success.

We‚Äôre looking for a Product Analyst to join our growing team!

About The Role

As a Product Analyst, you'll play a critical role in leveraging data to drive insights, optimise user experience, and identify growth opportunities within our fintech and crypto projects. By delivering clear, data-backed recommendations, you will empower stakeholders to make impactful product decisions. In this role, you will analyse extensive datasets, map user journeys, and build actionable insights that inform key business strategies. You'll collaborate closely with product owners, developers, and other data teams to drive our product analytics efforts, from optimising data storage and retrieval processes to managing UAT testing to unearth issues not captured by data.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis:


Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Map out user experience patterns and conversion funnels
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to support business decision-making
Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis


Product Analysis And Reporting


Identify growth opportunities by analysing user behaviour data
Define, calculate, and validate product metrics to measure the success of new features
Generate hypotheses and conduct A/B test to achieve improvements in user experience and conversion funnels
Collaborate closely with product managers and developers, overseeing A/B tests from experiment design to result interpretation
Conduct competitive analysis to benchmark against industry standards and identify growth opportunities
Presenting findings to stakeholders and consult with insights regularly


User Acceptance Testing (UAT)


Define acceptance criteria: Clearly outline what constitutes "acceptance" of the system.
Prepare test scenarios: Based on real-world use cases to validate critical workflows.
Plan the test: Set up timelines, resources, and tools for UAT.
Execute testing: End-users test the system and provide feedback.
Report issues: Document bugs, gaps, or usability concerns


Data Management


Ensure data integrity and accuracy by implementing best practices in data collection and analysis
Work with Product and data teams to optimise data storage and retrieval processes


Communication


Present findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Translate complex data into understandable and actionable business terms
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support initiatives with data-driven insights


About You


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field. Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or Ph.D.) is a plus
Proven experience as a Product Analyst or similar role
Proficiency in SQL (window functions, data joins from various databases, CTEs, data marts experience)
Experience in conducting A/B tests with conversion, quantitative, and ratio metrics
Experience with onboarding processes and activation conversion metrics
Sharp presentation skills, fact based and data driven in house consultancy
Experience with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, Amplitude, Singular, Looker, or similar
Experience in the crypto or FinTech industry is highly desirable
Optional: Proficiency in Python (pandas, seaborn, sklearn, scipy)

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, Risk Management, Trading Risk, Equities, Fixed Income, Currencies and Commodities, Data Analytics

About The Job

The Financial Resources Analytics is accountable for delivering excellence in all trading risk strategy activities we lead or oversee. This includes ensuring that these activities align with the Bank's objectives, client goals, approved risk appetites, and strategic priorities.

Your Main Activities Are


Assess and challenge the allocation and management of Risk and Resources (R&R) by the Business Lines (FICC) to ensure a strategic optimization of returns
Analyse Risk measures linked to capital consumption of Bank activities and ensure that return is optimised for capital allocation
Comply with all legal and regulatory requirements, and anticipate/ plan future regulatory changes, in relation to R&R management and capital allocation
Propose and implement solutions to facilitate new trades when BNPP‚Äôs risk appetite is reached
Identify and suggest innovative ideas to improve the Bank‚Äôs risk processes and reduce inaccuracies
Understand and monitor the main characteristics and concentrations of the risk portfolio managed by the team
Prepare periodic and ad-hoc reports on individual counterparties, sectors and/ or country crisis
Contribute to the reporting of the main risks and stress-tests across Global Markets
Maintain, improve and develop a toolbox for efficient risk management


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Financial Mathematics or Engineering
Interest in Financial Markets
Expertise with data analysis‚Äì Python, VBA and SQL (Strongly referred)
Ability to provide clear and concise analysis
Process oriented with a problem-solving mindset
Curiosity, Attention to detail and Autonomy
Ability to communicate clearly ‚Äì both oral and written forms
Fluency in English
Structured, methodical and organized approach to work


About The Team

The Global Equities and Fixed Income Currencies and Commodities (FICC) Trading Risk Strategy (TRS) Team is responsible for managing trading positions' risk and returns. To achieve this, we oversee the daily production of key position reports and stress tests for trading desks, as well as a weekly in-depth review of positions and Profit/ Loss (P&L) performance. Additionally, we participate in ad-hoc studies and deep dives to assess specific portfolio risks and expected returns, upon request.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Business Analyst (BI)
Description:
Main Tasks And Responsibilities

Noesis is looking for candidates with the following profile:


Analyze and document business requirements for BI projects.
Design and develop BI data models.
Provide training and support to BI tool users


Requirements


Degree in Management Information Systems or similar;
Minimum of 5 years as a Business Analyst (preferably in projects BI);
Knowledge of basic BI modeling concepts (Star Schema and/or snowflake);
Knowledge of ETL;
Experience in data modeling and SQL.
Excellent communication skills.
Dynamism, proactivity and ability to work in a team;


If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Title: Head of Business Intelligence, Poker
Description:
Title: Head of Business Intelligence

Department: Data

Location: Europe, Remote

About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to grow we are now looking for an ambitious and self-driven Head of Business Intelligence to join our rapidly growing team!

About The Role

We are seeking an experienced and strategic leader to shape the way we see crypto poker. As the Head of Business Intelligence, you will drive the organization‚Äôs data strategy, transforming data into actionable insights to support key business decisions. This role involves optimizing data processes, and leveraging advanced analytics to identify growth opportunities, improve operational efficiency, and enhance overall performance. If you thrive in a data-driven environment and are passionate about influencing business success through analytics, this is the role for you.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Reporting:


Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports to support business decision-making
Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis


Poker-Specific Insights


Utilise your poker experience to analyse game performance and player behaviour
Assess the impact of game features, promotions, and marketing campaigns on player engagement and revenue
Identify opportunities for optimising game mechanics and user experience and revenue
Conduct competitive analysis to benchmark against industry standards and identify growth opportunities


Data Management


Ensure data integrity and accuracy by implementing best practices in data collection and analysis
Work with Product and data teams to optimise data storage and retrieval processes


Communication


Present findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Translate complex data into understandable and actionable business terms
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support initiatives with data-driven insights


Highly Desired Knowledge And Experience


Experience in Poker: Experience in the gaming industry is highly desirable, preferably poker


About You


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or Ph.D.) is a plus
Proven experience as a BI Analyst or similar role
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, Node JS , or similar
Experience with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, Amplitude, SingularLooker, or similar
Strong understanding of data warehousing and ETL processes
Knowledge of crypto would be beneficial
Experience in the gaming industry is highly desirable; Poker and Casino

Title: BDO Static Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The BDO Static Data Analyst‚Äôs mission is to be responsible for the setup and maintenance of client database and ISIN database, in order to allow the integration of order received by the client. It is also a 1st level control for the trades monitoring and correcting any trade with errors

Your Main Activities Are


Ensure Integration and maintenance of clients‚Äô database (either manually or through support to the upload function)
Monitor error queues and trade recycling on a real time basis
Manage the Securities shared database
Mitigate risk exposure through a proper follow-up of procedures and alert/escalation mechanisms
Keep the Team Leader informed about the clients‚Äô activity and escalate issues whenever appropriate
Keep the procedures update
Ensure execution of tasks and complete checklist

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Economics / Finance / Accounting or related
Up to 2 years of experience in Banking and Financial Operations or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in MS Office Pack (Excel, PowerPoint)
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Ability to share / pass on knowledge
Communication skills, both written and oral
Client focused

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.


Show more

Title: Data Visualization Engineer
Description:
Liminal is a global market intelligence and strategic advisory firm specializing in digital identity, financial crime and compliance, and IT security technology solutions across industries while also catering to the private equity and venture capital community. Founded in 2016, Liminal offers strategic and analytical services supporting executive decision-making at all product and business lifecycle stages. We advise some of the world‚Äôs most prominent business leaders, investors, and policymakers on building, acquiring, and investing in the next generation of solutions and technologies. We provide access to proprietary data and analysis, strategic frameworks, and integrated insights on the industry‚Äôs only market intelligence platform.

Every major company in the world has started focusing on the next generation of digital identity technologies as a necessity for continued growth and security. Our team works with a myriad of organizations, from Fortune 100s to startups, across industries including financial services, technology, telecommunications, and the P2P economy. At Liminal, we help businesses build solutions, execute strategies, invest intelligently, and connect with key decision-makers. We know that it‚Äôs in the sharing of discovery and insights that groundwork is laid, problems are solved, and entire sectors advance at the speed of light. Keeping information to ourselves delays progress for all. At Liminal, we don't just respond to the market; we define it.

About The Role

We are seeking a talented and passionate Data Visualization Engineer to join our team and elevate the way users interact with data on Link, our web-based actionable intelligence platform. In this role, you will design and develop intuitive, interactive, and impactful data visualizations that transform complex information into actionable insights. Collaborating closely with product managers, designers, and engineers, you will play a critical role in creating a seamless and engaging user experience. Your expertise in React development and data visualization techniques will be key to delivering meaningful visualizations that drive value for our users.

What You'll Do

Data Visualization Design


Design and implement user-friendly data visualizations that effectively communicate complex information.
Develop interactive charts, graphs, and dashboards using React and modern visualization libraries (e.g., D3.js, Recharts, Chart.js).
Ensure data visualizations are responsive, accessible, and consistent with the platform's design system.
Translate user requirements into intuitive visual representation strategies, optimizing usability and engagement.


Prototyping and Testing


Create and iterate on prototypes to visualize design concepts and gather feedback from stakeholders.
Conduct usability testing to ensure visualizations meet user needs and identify opportunities for improvement.
Use analytics and user feedback to refine and enhance existing visualizations.


Collaboration and Implementation


Work closely with product managers and UX designers to align visualization designs with user and business goals.
Collaborate with front-end engineers to ensure seamless integration and performance optimization of visualizations.
Maintain and improve a reusable visualization component library for consistent implementation across the platform.


Continuous Learning and Development


Stay updated on the latest trends, tools, and best practices in data visualization, React development, and UI/UX design.
Share knowledge and insights with the team to drive innovation and improvement.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science, Design, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data visualization development, preferably for web-based or SaaS platforms.
Proficiency in React and related tools/libraries.
Experience with data visualization libraries such as D3.js, Recharts, or Chart.js.
Experience with data BI tools such as Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Strong understanding of data visualization principles and the ability to craft visualizations that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing.
Familiarity with responsive design, accessibility standards, and cross-browser compatibility.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate in a cross-functional team environment.
Show more

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Arabic Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more
HTML:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities

  • SOP Clarification and Training:
  • Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
  • Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
  • Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
  • Quality Improvement and Assurance:
  • Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
  • Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
  • Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
  • Project Management:
  • Ensure timely delivery of projects
  • Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
  • Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
  • 1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
  • Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
  • Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
  • Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
  • Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
  • Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Data Engineer - Lisbon (Internal Team)
Description:
At Efficio, we're not just a consulting firm; we're a team of dedicated experts committed to transforming procurement and supply chain functions. Our mission is to drive sustainable, measurable value for our clients through innovative solutions and deep industry insights. Join us and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and ideas make a real impact.

Efficio is the world‚Äôs largest specialist procurement and supply chain consultancy, with offices across Europe, North America, and the Middle East. We‚Äôre a diverse team of over 1,000 individuals, representing more than 60 different nationalities and speaking 40+ languages ‚Äì and we‚Äôre continuing to grow rapidly!

We believe we can make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better. Buying better isn't just about saving money; it's also helping businesses to make the world around them better by buying products and services that that are from green, ethical, sustainable, diverse and inclusive suppliers. At Efficio, we do that by being the world's largest procurement and supply chain consultancy firm. We also do that by combining our procurement expertise with our powerful technology and data to help our customers make better purchasing decisions. Data is a fundamental ingredient to that decision making process and we're now investing heavily in building our in-house data skills, expertise and infrastructure to rival the best in the world. So, if you'd like to make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better, apply here. Please note this role is a non-consulting position.

In this job you will develop and implement data pipelines on AWS, maintain and develop them further under guidance of business owners. You will work alongside Data Scientists, Data Engineers and others; integrated in our Product and Digital team. This role offers the chance to join Efficio at a pivotal point in our data journey, and to shape and influence our data landscape.

This role gives you the opportunity to:


Collect business requirements and translate them into robust and scalable solutions
Demonstrate an understanding of DataOps and develop use case agnostic ETL pipelines
Take a proactive approach to work and become a go-to expert for data cloud migration
Work with state-of-the-art tooling on AWS including Redshift, S3 and ECS
Collaborate with our infrastructure engineers to provision the next generation of tools
Develop a sense of ownership to deliver high quality outcomes for the business
Make complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable by the organisation


We'd love to hear about any additional skills or experiences you bring to the table. We're particularly interested in:


An advanced degree in software engineering, computer science, a related technical field, or relevant work experience
Proven experience in building robust and reliable data pipelines, dealing with a wide variety of data sources
Strong experience in Python, knowledge of data wrangling methodologies and common packages
Proficiency with AWS Tools (e.g., S3, Athena, Glue, Lamba, Kinesis) as well as AWS CI/CD and readiness to learn/work with them
Experience with Docker, Airflow, and SQLs (ideally Postgres)
Fundamental understanding of programming landscape (e.g., APIs, SQL, database management)
Great communication skills, comfortable working collaboratively in cross-functional teams
Ability to manage own workload with a customer focus and solution orientated can-do attitude

Title: Business Intelligence Data Scientist
Description:
About The Job


The Business Intelligence Data Scientist‚Äôs main mission is to support the industrialization of the Global Banking Transactional Profile project, collaborating with CIB Analytics and CIB IT regional teams to explore the transactional systems and draw insights to better understand the behavior of Corporate and Institutional Banking (CIB) customers. The Data Scientist plays a key role in leveraging data to create value and drive growth for the business


Your Main Activities Are


Automate Transactional Banking (TB) business dashboards as prototypes and prepare them to be put in production, working closely with the team‚Äôs data analysts
Collect, clean, and analyze large data sets from various transactional sources to identify trends, patterns and insights
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data quality checks and validation processes
Identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend data-driven solutions
Conduct prescriptive and predictive modelling
Collaborate with department heads who request business analysis
Contribute to the development and governance of our data and support the different business lines with data-driven decision-making

Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or any related field
At least 3 years of experience in big data, data management and data processing
Fluency in English
Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools, particularly Excel
Analytical abilities with a proactive and curious approach
Great organizational and communication abilities


About The Team


Within CIB, the Transaction Banking business concerns two fundamental business lines
The Cash Management line, which concerns all products that assist our customers with their liquidity needs, such as current accounts, term deposits, payments and collections, forex, among others
The Global Trade Solutions line, which concerns all products that assist our customers with their global trade needs, such as letters of credit, guarantees, supply chain management, factoring, among others
The Global TB COO team assists different business teams in multiple topics, both on daily and monthly needs as in project mode, where a small team of data analysts and scientists focus on data and are involved in the conception of data use cases from exploration phase up to production delivery

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst for Risk Anticipation
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action.

We are committed to promoting access to more responsible and sustainable consumption to support our customers and partners. To achieve this, we implement concrete actions, not only in the way we develop our business and enhance our sustainable growth, with the ambition to reduce our environmental footprint, but also in the way we support those who need it most.

BNPP Personal Finance is, by nature, exposed to Fraud, and relies heavily on quantitative models and strong analytics to manage it. Each day, millions of credit granting decisions are made, using hundreds of decision rules and models. The importance and complexity of these ecosystems at use within BNPP-PF keep on rising as the digital transformation accelerates.

In practice, your day-to-day


Risk Anticipation team is in charge of the IFRS9 provisioning calculation methodology and must ensure that the method is properly applied throughout the BNP Paribas Personal Finance perimeter.
The main role of the Risk Anticipation analyst is to ensure the correct level of provisioning for BNPP PF outstandings, and to ensure the correct application of the IFRS9 provisioning methodology throughout the scope of Personal Finance.
He is the direct international contact point for the local Risk teams.
The Risk Anticipation team is mainly located in Paris, and we are opening a new position in Lisbon.
The main activities will be:
Simulation of application of provisioning method on BNPP PF portfolios.
Developing mathematical language program models in SAS and Python.
Analyze the level of Risk of BNPP Portfolios through data at customer level.
Daily exchange with your colleagues in Paris.

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!


Within BNP Paribas Personal Finance, Central Risk Department is responsible for the relevance of risk rating models used within all local entities and for maintaining a high level of expertise with integrating new statistical techniques in new modelling environments.
You will operate in a friendly and international work environment, designed to make the collaborating experience as pleasant as possible!
You will have regular exchanges with the Central (this will help to build up competence based on different cultures and levels of responsibility).
You will participate to projects and strategics activities, part of the Strategic Plan of BNPP PF.
The Risk Anticipation team is mainly located in Paris, you will be located in Lisbon and you will join the Credit Risk Optimization team in Lisbon and working on Risk Anticipation topics.


What do we have to offer you?


This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.


Are you the one we are looking for?


Have you a few experiences in Credit Risk Management, with mathematical/statistical background and a few years of successful experience, preference in a Bank, a financial environment, or a digital business?
Do you know Python or other database language (SAS, SQL)?
Do you have knowledge about IFRS9 norms standards? Or about IRB models (PD, EaD, LGD)?
Are you able to work on several projects at the same time and are known for your rigor?
Are you comfortable communicating orally and in writing with different interlocutors and sharing information?
Are you doing everything you can to achieve your goals?
Do you have a good knowledge in Excel and Power point?
Do you have important analytics & business skills as:
Applied Math and Algorithms
Data Processing, Data Knowledge
Descriptive Modelling and Predictive Modelling
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Analytical Ability
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Ability to Synthetise/Simplify
Do you speak English? French is a plus.
If you have all this, a lot of desire, energy, and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for‚Ä¶
We look forward to your application!


Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand
Show more

Title: Product Analyst - ComparaJ√°
Description:
About us

Our mission is to help consumers save time and money by matching them with the best products for their banking, insurance, and utility needs. We work towards becoming the largest distributor of financial services. ComparaJ√°.pt is part of Samlino Group (https://samlinogroup.com/). We operate across five markets, empowering users reach healthier financial lives.

What we offer you

You'll have the unique opportunity to be a key driver of our exponential growth curve. In your daily work, you will work directly with our Founder and senior teams.

Sunny Lisbon will be your home base, but you'll travel between our five markets (Portugal, Denmark, Belgium, Finland and Greece)!

Your Responsibilities

You will be accountable for your own projects and will be responsible for driving results across various ventures and initiatives. Your responsibilities in this job will evolve and be defined and redefined throughout your time with us. The aim is to take ownership of and drive the development of progressively larger opportunities.

What we expect from you

We are looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a results-oriented environment to join our team and help us reach our objectives. Industry experience is not a requirement, but you do need to be highly ambitious, proactive, forward-thinking, a fast learner, and driven to succeed.

Furthermore, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a proactive mindset, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a track record of successfully owning projects from conception to completion
Possess an unwavering drive and desire to be the very best at what they do
Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
EU work permit is required


Start date and Location

Flexible start date

This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office
