What we expect from you

We are looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a results-oriented environment to join our team and help us reach our objectives. Industry experience is not a requirement, but you do need to be highly ambitious, proactive, forward-thinking, a fast learner, and driven to succeed.

Furthermore, we are looking for candidates who:

  • Have a proactive mindset, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
  • Are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a track record of successfully owning projects from conception to completion
  • Possess an unwavering drive and desire to be the very best at what they do
  • Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
  • Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
  • Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
  • Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
  • Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
  • Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
  • Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
  • EU work permit is required

Start date and Location

Flexible start date

This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office

Title: Quantitative Backtesting Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Quantitative Backtesting Analyst‚Äôs mission is to develop and maintain the Model Performance Assessment methodology of internal rating models on the Basel credit risk parameters (PD, LGD, EAD / CCF), or contribute to other studies and projects within team's responsibility

Your Main Activities Are


Contribute to the production of backtesting on risk parameters by producing the different steps: Data collection, Database construction, Back testing production, Report preparation
Contribute to the production of the backtesting ECB Templates
Contribute to the production of the backtesting Shortcuts
Participation in transversal projects related to credit risk models performance assessment
Control and validation of LGD spreadsheet
Improvement of existing tools and processes
Ensure a robust permanent control framework to deliver in a timely manner, reliable and consistent backtesting
Identify lack of model performance using statistics defined in the back-testing methodology
Analyse and document the results, deep dive analyses are performed, built on good understanding of the risk models and strong cooperation with risk modelling and risk management teams
Communicate results to the regulator and relevant internal teams such as model validation team and capital team

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Mathematics / Statistics or related
Up to 2 years of experience in Risk and Controls or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in MS Office Excel
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Ability to develop and adapt a process
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral
Problem solving

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Process Optimisation Manager
Description:
Typical Accountabilities:



Coordinate the implementation of analytical and data visualization solutions designed to drive the interrogation of datasets for insights in scientific and business application areas within defined project scope. Solutions may employ the use of dedicated business intelligence applications and/or cloud services but may also leverage the reporting capabilities of existing ERP, CRM and/or database software vendors and analytical software such as R, Python, Matlab, and others. These solutions may also require exploratory and predictive analytic statistical models for ongoing and ad hoc review and analysis of data.
Coordinate the translation of business problems into the appropriate analytics problem and solutions in the project scope
Build and manage effective relationships with a range of stakeholders to ensure utilization and value of information resources and services. Clearly and objectively communicate results, as well as their associated uncertainties and limitations
Provide expertise in exploratory, descriptive and predictive data analytics to cross-functional projects and shape delivery of solutions that drive business value
Develop visualizations and tools to support and deliver innovative and complex analytical solutions
Develop and apply ongoing knowledge and awareness in trends, standard methodology and new developments in analytics to shape solutions
Review and develop working practices to ensure that work is delivered to robust quality standards within defined scope
Provide training and advice to collaborators on optimal use of key data and analysis
Develop, implement and maintain required tools in a manner which meets regulatory and evidential requirements, within the project scope
Leads small (2-3 person) projects of defined scope



Typical People Management Responsibility (direct / indirect reports):



Approximate number of people managed in total (all levels) - 2-3



What is the global remit? (how many countries will the role operate in?):



Another country



Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience:



Essential: Bachelors Degree in relevant discipline or equivalent years of experience; Demonstrated knowledge of data analytic and visualization tools such as R, Python, SpotFire or Tableau.; Familiarity with database systems (eg SQL, NoSQL, graph); Advanced ability to draw conclusions from data and present in a succinct fashion to stakeholders; Demonstrated experience in the complex analysis of data in applied business and/or scientific application domains; Software development skills; Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills; Good understanding of at least one business area where the data science is applied
Desirable: Masters Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Statistics, Economics, or a related quantitative discipline.; Comfortable working in high performance computing or cloud environment; Experience in life sciences and healthcare



Key Relationship to reach solutions:



Internal (to AZ or team): Project and program managers; Key business and scientific collaborators; Mid to senior level managers in scoping and prioritizing opportunities
External (to AZ): Support services from key vendors; Peers across professional groups; Academic collaborators in relevant areas

Title: Data Engineer (Python & Azure)
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that specializes 100% in its own #Data & #Analytics projects? If so, keep reading! üëÄ

Even though we are relatively unknown to the general public, at SDG we work for half of the IBEX-35 groups and other international companies. Thanks to the analytics boom, we are growing steadily and have been helping our clients understand and analyse their data since 1994.




What makes us different? üßê

In our projects, data and technology are the leaders, we will train you to be able to work with the latest in the market (we have an innovation area where we promote new partnerships with technology manufacturers and R&D centers).
You will have all the opportunities to develop your best self, with a completely customized career plan in which you will learn on your own and also have the support of your colleagues. You will set your own time, you will talk to your manager every six months to share feedback and new challenges, and based on your results, there will be a salary review.
We are a big family, from the first moment we will try to make your life easier. Your colleagues and the rest of the team will always have a smile on their faces and will be ready to help and support you.
You will collaborate and work on a daily basis with great references (technical and/or business), they will be happy to teach you as much as possible and will be proud to see you grow.
Smartwork is possible with us. You will experience a way of working where everyone manages their own time.
We are a brand with purpose. We believe that diversity and inclusion help promote a culture of creativity, allowing us to overcome new situations and challenges as an organization committed to people and society.
Getting into more formal matters, but not less important, we offer a permanent contract, we want you to stay with us for a long time! A competitive salary according to your level of training and experience (don't worry, we will discuss this aspect in the first interview and inform you if your expectations are aligned).




We could go on and on about what makes us special, and we'd love to do it in a phone call. For now, let's show you some details that we're sure you'll find interesting üëáüèº







What will be your mission? ‚úç

Analysis, design and development of solutions and projects in the field of data engineering in Business Intelligence.
Data processing and development of ETL processes.
Creation and modeling of Data Marts in relational, dimensional and/or table environments.
Build and maintain positive relationships with client staff at all levels;
Be updated on the latest technological trends in the field of Analytics.







What will make you succeed in this position? üëá

Bachelor/Master in a field that emphasizes data analysis (Computer Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Engineering or Statistics).
Experience over 3 years in the field of Analytics, ideally in service/consulting companies.
Experience using Spark and Delta for data processing and analysis.
Familiarity with Azure Data Factory pipelines, as well as deep CI/CD knowledge.
Proficiency in Python programming and SQL Server.
Innovative spirit with balanced customer, business and technology orientation.
Interest in challenges, commitment, integrity, maturity, ability to work as a team and a high sense of responsibility.
Fluent level of English.







Finally, we would like to tell you about the stages of our selection process.




In Our Processes You Will Do 3Ô∏è Meetings

First contact with our People First area (where we will discuss professional growth, salary band and define which areas suit you).
Second technical session where you can surprise us with all your knowledge and skills in technological environments (so we can offer you a project that matches your knowledge and interests).
Meeting with the person in charge of the team you will be joining in order to solve any doubts that may have emerged during the process.







If you have passed all the phases, good news! You will receive a call from People First where we will present our offer for you to join us, and we will be able to answer any questions you may have. When you confirm that you want to be part of the SDG family, we will start preparing everything to welcome you with great enthusiasm.




You can't join us now, but you are interested in SDG Group? Don't worry, you can go through the selection process now and we will consider you for the next job opportunities that match your professional profile.




JOIN NOW, WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

#WeAreSDG #SDGGroup #WhySDG

Title: Operations Analyst
Description:
ComparaJ√°.pt

ComparaJ√°.pt is a free and independent online comparison platform for financial services and products, with a clear mission: to help people saving time and money, in a quick and simple comparison tool.

Our goal is for Portuguese consumers to make informed and conscious financial decisions. For this, we provide a free, impartial, thorough and independent platform, where people can compare the various financial providers in the Portuguese market for home loans, personal loans, credit cards, telecommunication and energy providers, life insurance and saving accounts.

We are the #1 personal finance platform in Portugal for the users, our partners and media channels. We are part of Samlino Group, a European Investment Company that helps Europeans save time and money by making better choices about insurance, home services and banking products. In Europe, our sister companies are: Samlino.dk (Denmark), VertaaEnsin.fi (Finland), TopCompare.be & Tariefchecker.be (Belgium), and Pricefox.gr (Greece).

What You'll Do


You will support expansion and daily operations, analyzing operational and marketing trends and participating in strategic projects.
You will be responsible and have full ownership of analytical work, with direct reporting to one of our Head of Energy and Broadband.
You will collaborate with the different Marketing Teams (SEO, PR, paid social, Search), Product and Operational teams, being the point of contact for the key projects you are leading.
You will cooperate within a multicultural and multidisciplinary team developing and improving processes, with direct contact with the Group leadership team.


What We Expect from you

You possess an unparalleled work ethic with a high sense of urgency. You have a relentless drive and desire to be the very best at what you do. You take ownership of everything you do, are proactive and follow through on commitments. Moreover, you're humble and you share our passion for building and executing new businesses. Furthermore, we expect that you:


Have acquired a bachelor or master's degree with outstanding results in Management, Marketing, Economics, Finance, Engineering or another related field. Financial knowledge is a plus.
You are knowledgeable in MS Office and analytical tools. SQL knowledge is a plus.
You have a strong sense of ownership and initiative and a genuine interest in learning and act on the desire.
You have a strong affinity for critical thinking, analytical, hands-on execution, problem-solving, and result-orientation.
Ideally you are available to start in September 2024 and have an EU work permit.
Plus: You are passionate about Marketing and Management, with a taste for Finance.


What We Offer


A workplace with great talents and leaders that will inspire and challenge you daily.
Responsibility for high impact projects that constantly push you out of your comfort zone and give you the opportunity to be the best you can.
Competitive compensation and benefits.
Assume responsibility and decision-making authority from your first day.
Work on exciting and challenging projects and create an impact with new, innovative ideas.
Grow personally and professionally from working both independently and as part of an international group.
Work with and learn from experts and mentors in diverse fields.
Create strong and meaningful connections with your team members at exciting company events.
Be part of one of the most promising Portuguese fintech startups, with one goal in mind: help the Portuguese people saving money.

Title: Lead Insight Analyst
Description:
Who We Are: At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work. Lead Insight Analyst required to joining our rapidly expanding Data Analytics team on a permanent basis.

The opportunity:

As a Lead Insight Analyst you will have the opportunity to work on some of our largest projects and key accounts. Reporting to the Head of Data Analytics, you will be responsible for analysing digital behaviour in order to provide key, actionable insight and critical recommendations to our clients. This is more than just an insight role; it‚Äôs an opportunity to help shape the digital strategies of some of the world‚Äôs leading brands and retailers! You will be tool agnostic and you will use tools like Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics for tracking data, GTM, Adobe Launch or Tealium for implementing tags and a mixture of data visualization tool as well as Excel and Powerpoint for visualisation. Additionally, you will be managing a small team of Analysts and will be providing oversight to ensure that their delivering tool quality analysis outputs.

Please note that this job is a full-time position located in Lisbon or Porto, but the selection process will be conducted in English.

Please send over your CV in English. What you‚Äôll be doing: Shaping, sell and deliver large analytics programs of work.

Creating measurement plans that identify the customer behaviour to be tracked (you will work closely with our implementation analysts for this)

Establishing detailed reporting and visualisations that help our clients understand the performance of their digital channels

Using measurement tools to analyse digital user behaviours in detail, across a wide range of digital properties (websites, mobile applications, instore devices)

Creating detailed insight reports that cover key findings and recommendations

Presenting your findings to a senior-level client audience and helping them understand what it means for their business

Working with our internal UX and design teams to inform the creation of new websites and apps

Answering client queries and running training sessions with them

Having line management duties for a small team of analysts, including developing their skillset and driving the quality of their work

What we want from you: Extensive experience working as a Lead Analyst providing insight, ideally in an ecommerce setting (client or agency)

Must have Advanced practical knowledge of Analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Content Square)

Numerically adept in using Excel (or similar) to analyse data

Previous experience supporting junior team members

Highly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint

Extensive experience working with senior client stakeholders

Effective time management and multitasking abilities

A proven track record of delivering large insight projects for leading B2C organisations

What we can offer you: Alongside the opportunity to work with some of the most exciting brands around the world, we‚Äôll also prioritise your career development and help you grow your skills. We‚Äôll empower you to make a difference, allow you to be yourself, and respect who you are. We offer a great benefits package including social events, training opportunities, medical and dental insurance, life assurance, meal cards and much more. Our personality and behaviours: We believe that we are what we do, not just what we say. Our shared values and behaviours show how to bring the VML Enterprise Solution's culture to life through the actions we all take every day: Connect Meaningfully Inspire Creatively Include Purposefully Approach Positively Our brilliant, talented people are what makes VML Enterprise Solutions what we are. That‚Äôs why we look for people who go beyond and always push our thinking to be better than yesterday. AT VML Enterprise Solutions Our Enterprise Solutions division houses strategic consultants, creative and technical architects and skilled developers and operators that together help some of the world‚Äôs leading organisations to deliver outstanding digital experiences across all major routes to market worldwide: marketplaces, online retailers, D2C, B2B and social platforms. With over 4,200 experts in 55 operational centres across 34 countries, our capabilities span the entire buying journey from customer acquisition, through engagement, to conversion and loyalty, driving multi-channel growth for world-leading brands. We work with some of the most exciting brands such as The Coca-Cola Company, EY, Bosch, Unilever, Ford, DFS, Mercedes-Benz, Johnson & Johnson, Nestl√©, Sainsbury‚Äôs, Selfridges, Shell and Tiffany & Co. We‚Äôve built over 500 platforms for brands and retailers and generate in excess of $29bn annually for our clients and work with over 50 strategic partners including Adobe, SAP, Salesforce, HCL, Shopify, Sitecore, BigCommerce, commerce tools and Acquia. Our reputation is based on our people, and we believe we have some of the best in the business. As our business grows internationally, we‚Äôre looking for new people to join us on our journey to inspire and take a key role in shaping some of the best commerce solutions, services, and websites in the world. Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable; we share in our client‚Äôs successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team. In our Lisbon or Porto office, you‚Äôll join a team of other specialists who are always ready to help each other. The team is part of our Enterprise Solutions network and works in coordination with our Local and EMEA client leads.

VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization‚Äîcreators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers‚Äîwho drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.

With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work. Lead Insight Analyst required to joining our rapidly expanding Data Analytics team on a permanent basis.

The opportunity:

As a Lead Insight Analyst you will have the opportunity to work on some of our largest projects and key accounts. Reporting to the Head of Data Analytics, you will be responsible for analysing digital behaviour in order to provide key, actionable insight and critical recommendations to our clients. This is more than just an insight role; it‚Äôs an opportunity to help shape the digital strategies of some of the world‚Äôs leading brands and retailers! You will be tool agnostic and you will use tools like Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics for tracking data, GTM, Adobe Launch or Tealium for implementing tags and a mixture of data visualization tool as well as Excel and Powerpoint for visualisation. Additionally, you will be managing a small team of Analysts and will be providing oversight to ensure that their delivering tool quality analysis outputs.

Please note that this job is a full-time position located in Lisbon or Porto, but the selection process will be conducted in English.

Please send over your CV in English. What you‚Äôll be doing: Shaping, sell and deliver large analytics programs of work.

Creating measurement plans that identify the customer behaviour to be tracked (you will work closely with our implementation analysts for this)

Establishing detailed reporting and visualisations that help our clients understand the performance of their digital channels

Using measurement tools to analyse digital user behaviours in detail, across a wide range of digital properties (websites, mobile applications, instore devices)

Creating detailed insight reports that cover key findings and recommendations

Presenting your findings to a senior-level client audience and helping them understand what it means for their business

Working with our internal UX and design teams to inform the creation of new websites and apps

Answering client queries and running training sessions with them

Having line management duties for a small team of analysts, including developing their skillset and driving the quality of their work

What we want from you: Extensive experience working as a Lead Analyst providing insight, ideally in an ecommerce setting (client or agency)

Must have Advanced practical knowledge of Analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Content Square)

Numerically adept in using Excel (or similar) to analyse data

Previous experience supporting junior team members

Highly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint

Extensive experience working with senior client stakeholders

Effective time management and multitasking abilities

A proven track record of delivering large insight projects for leading B2C organisations

Title: Senior Associate Commercial Reporting
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) will be home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP will offer rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe‚Äôs most attractive cities.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo ‚Äì Sete Rios, Av. Jos√© Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you‚Äôre part of something bigger, it‚Äôs because you are. At Amgen our shared mission‚Äîto serve patients‚Äîdrives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world‚Äôs leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together‚Äîresearching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read ovemanar 10 million patients worldwide. It‚Äôs time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Commercial Reporting Sr. Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

The Commercial Analytics team at Amgen plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving commercial success. As a Commercial Reporting Senior Associate, you will lead insights generation by integrating multitude of secondary data sources and engaging several Commercial Data and Analytics (CD&A) colleagues to develop a comprehensive understanding of brand performance and provide tactical recommendations to drive it.

You, as our Commercial Analytics Senior Associate, plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving commercial success and stakeholder management. You will contribute to the reporting for brand and field performance, executing and managing discussions with CD&A leadership.

Responsibilities will include:


Assisting with field sales team which includes documenting new business requirements, developing new reports in Tableau, enhancing existing reports, and training.
Participate in cross functional teams to improve reports and reporting processes based on changing business trends.
Collaborate across functions to ensure precise documentation and application of business rules for all reporting deliverables
Contribute to creating and applying reporting QC standards and processes to maintain report accuracy
Support weekly release runs of field dashboards, portal communication and data inquiries.
Partner with field training team to build training materials and deliver training to new hires.
Ensure adherence to compliance/legal regulations.
Flexibility as new areas of responsibility are defined.
Collaborate with the broader CD&A organization to integrate comprehensive insights and analytics.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


Minimum 3 years of experience in Pharma/Biotech sales & marketing operations, finance and/or analytics and reporting experience
OR Master‚Äôs degree and 3 years of sales & marketing operations, finance and/or analytics experience
OR Bachelor‚Äôs degree and 5 years of analytics sales & marketing operations, finance and/or analytics experience
University Degree in commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel and PowerPoint knowledge


Preferred Requirements:


Experience in Tableau and data visualization
Knowledge or experience in data, analytics, and/or dashboarding & reporting approach
Analysis and project management skills to turn unstructured business issues into action plans that result in meaningful strategic or tactical recommendations.
Ability to drive implementation to enhance methodologies and standard processes.
Experience with data management, business analysis, and solution design/development
Ability to translate business requirements into innovative solutions.
Strong client service and communication skills ‚Äì written, oral, and presentation ‚Äì appropriately gauged to a broad range of audiences from senior leadership to front-line field staff and to peers in various subject areas.
Experience with brand, sales and activity reporting, incentive compensation, Plan of Action, field systems solutions like Veeva (salesforce.com), Javelin, and other systems such as Customer Master (Master Data Management solutions) and Reporting Solutions such as Cognos, Spotfire, Micro-strategies, etc.
Deep knowledge of pharmaceutical data including IMS DDD, Xponent data, Plan Track, Managed Markets and charge back data is highly desirable.
Expertise in Microsoft products Excel, Access, and PowerPoint.
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

For a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Eye Candy Solutions is currently seeking highly qualified professionals with a passion for data to join our team of Data Engineer. The ideal candidates will have a minimum of three years of experience.


Proficiency in data modeling, ETL processes, & data warehousing solutions.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer in Azure, w/ a strong focus on Microsoft Fabric.
Strong programming skills in languages such Python, SQL, or similar.
Experience wi/ PowerApps development is a plus DevOps CI/aCD experience.
Knowledge of other cloud providers (GCP) & Talend is a nice to have Strong analytical, problem-solving, & critical-thinking skills.


Essential Attributes


Self managed Result orientation, influence & impact.
Adaptability and curiosity.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to explain technology solutions in business terms.
You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun.


Languages

Fluent in English (proficient in French is preferred).

Type of contract: Fixed-term contract.

Project period: 12 months, with the possibility of extension.

Location:

Work pattern: 100% On-site.

Title: Data Engineer, Crypto
Description:
üè∑Ô∏èTitle: Data Engineer

üë´Department: RevOps

üìçLocation: UK or Europe, Remote

About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to grow we are now looking for an ambitious and self-driven Data Engineer to join our rapidly growing team!

About The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Engineer to lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of our unified analytical data warehouse. The ideal candidate is experienced in building scalable data pipelines, working with modern orchestration tools, and leveraging AWS services for data storage and processing. You will collaborate closely with data team to ensure data accuracy, reliability, and accessibility.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain a unified analytical data warehouse (DWH) to support business intelligence and advanced analytics.
Build, optimize, and scale ETL/ELT data pipelines to ingest data from diverse sources.
Implement best practices for data modelling, storage, and retrieval, ensuring performance and scalability.
Develop and manage workflows and data orchestration using tools like Apache Airflow, Prefect, or equivalent.
Ensure seamless integration of AWS services (e.g., Redshift, S3, Lambda) and ClickHouse for data storage and transformation.
Implement CI/CD pipelines for data workflows to ensure quality and agility in deployments.
Monitor, debug, and resolve issues related to data pipelines and systems.
Maintain documentation for data infrastructure, processes, and best practices.


About You

Technical Expertise:


Python: Proficiency in Python for building and optimizing data pipelines.
Data Orchestration: Hands-on experience with tools like Apache Airflow, Prefect, or Dagster.
CI/CD: Familiarity with CI/CD tools (e.g., GitHub Actions, Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD) for automating data workflows.
Data Modelling: Expertise in designing efficient and scalable data models (e.g., star/snowflake schemas).


General Skills


Proven experience in building and maintaining scalable, reliable ETL/ELT pipelines.
Strong SQL skills for querying and performance optimization.
Ability to work in an agile environment and adapt to evolving priorities.
Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Desired Qualifications


Cloud Platforms: experience with AWS services, including but not limited to Redshift, S3, Lambda, and Glue.
ClickHouse: Practical experience in working with ClickHouse for data processing and analysis.
Familiarity with Docker and container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
Knowledge of distributed computing and big data processing frameworks (e.g., Spark, Hadoop).
Experience with data governance, quality frameworks, and security best practices.
Strong understanding of crypto/blockchain

Title: Data Engineer (Fabric)
Description:
This is a remote position.

Job Description:

We are currently looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer with expertise in Fabric to join our team. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for creating, developing, and maintaining our data infrastructure and systems. You will work closely with our data analysts and scientists to ensure that our data is accurate, reliable, and easily accessible.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop, design, and maintain data infrastructure and systems in Azure / Fabric
Collaborate with data analysts and scientists to ensure data accuracy and reliability
Implement and develop data pipelines
Optimize and manage data storage and retrieval
Troubleshoot and monitor data issues
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering
Work closely with DevOps team to ensure smooth deployment and operation of data systems


Requirements


Strong experience with services such as Azure Data Factory, PowerBI and Synapse.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Benefits

Remote work

Training and access to certification vouchers

Work-life balance initiatives

All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: DATA ENGINEER - MID
Description:
DATA ENGINEER - MID (HYBRID)

Portuguese company hires for remote / hybrid work

Location: Lisbon / Portugal

Seniority: More than 2 years of professional experience

Working model: Hybrid

Language Requirements: Fluent Portuguese and English (C1)

Sector: Telecom Industry

Instructions: Please submit your resume in English and include all skills and experience that meet the requirements of the position. This will significantly increase your chances of success.

Your Role


Design, develop, and maintain ELTL processes, leveraging expertise in Big Data technologies.
Actively contribute to technical discussions within the team.
Understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.


Your Profile


Degree in Computer Engineering or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data engineering.
Fluent Portuguese (Native) and Advanced English.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Experience with Agile methodologies.
Proficiency in data modeling to enhance data retrieval and analytics.
Ability to gather and prioritize data requirements, ensuring alignment with business objectives.


Required Skills


Data Warehouse / Data Lake architecture.
SQL (Procedures, Views, Triggers).
Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Terraform for infrastructure as code.
PL/SQL (minimum of 2 years of experience).


Nice To Have


Experience in the Telecom industry.

Data Engineer ‚Äì Data Foundation Team (Hybrid)

At DSV, we are on a journey to renew the Global Data and Analytics Platform that is being used by colleagues, customers and Business Partners in all Business Domains to get the most information out of available data.

Our department members are placed in numerous locations around Europe, Asia and South Africa.

A significant part of our department is located in Lisbon, grouped in development and operations teams.

For the Data Foundation Team, we are looking for a Data Engineer to support the team of currently 3 team members plus the Manager.

The position is part of the Global organisation and work will be in close collaboration with colleagues across locations in the department.

To achieve our goals, we are working on an ambitioned plan and have chosen a vendor who is offering us a full stack of services. All of our work is done in the cloud, utilising the full stack of Microsoft‚Äôs offering: Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Server /Azure SQL Synapse, Azure Analysis Services, DataBricks, PowerBI Services, Azure Data Factory, Azure DevOps.

DSV will also embark on a multi cloud strategy and introduce technologies to facilitate cloud provider agnosticism.

The Data Foundation team works as technology spearheads and supports the delivery and operations teams with tools, frameworks, processes, and coaching. We deliver in an agile way with Jira as our management tool.

As a Data Engineer in Data Foundation Team, your major responsibilities will be:



Manage and optimize cross department tools.
Be a key member in cross data foundation implementation projects.
Analyse existing applications and optimize their performance.
Design and implement solutions that will support the development of our Operational Data Warehouse (ODW) in alignment with IT Architectural principles, guidelines, and standards.
Rapidly build up understanding of existing architecture and underlying business processes
Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines for ingesting, processing, and transforming large volumes of data from various sources.
Analyse requirements together with our different department teams.
Document and provide technical specifications for the implementations.
Refine and promote our agile delivery framework to help ensure high quality and flexible deliverables on the data & BI platform.
Actively transfer knowledge to other team members as well as the Operations & Support team.



Skills & Competencies

To perform the job successfully you should demonstrate the following competencies:



Analytical Skills: Ability for systematic and rational analysis to identify the root cause of problems.
Delivery & Project Management: Experience with Agile methodology, and the ability to promote and facilitate deliveries accordingly.
Conversational Skills: Being comfortable in international business communication, able to communicate openly and confidently, able to listen effectively, able to influence and convince others in a way that results in acceptance and agreement.
Personal Skills: Ability to work with different cultures and to manage cross functional interfaces, high priority for teamwork, capable to build strong and long-term team relationships within and across functions and geographical boundaries and based on ethics and trust, ready to take personal accountability for achieving individual and shared goals.



Required Experience:



Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in computer sciences, Data Science, Information Technology or a related field.
3-5 years of experiences in BI/Data Engineering projects.



Technical requirements:



Expert knowledge of Microsoft‚Äôs Data stack: Azure Datalake, Azure SQL Database/Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Synapse integration, DevOps, etc
Ability to monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines for performance and reliability.
Experience with profiling and tuning queries for efficiency.
Experience in working with GIT repositories.
Experiences of Agile methodology and CI/CD practices.
Experience with task management tools (JIRA, Confluence)
Experience with Databricks and Pyspark/Scala/Spark SQL
Expert Knowledge of data governance principles to ensure data quality, lineage, and compliance.



Languages



Proficient Level of English (spoken and written)



Our offer:



Permanent contract
Private medical care
English courses - financial or co-financed by company
Food allowance
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work (3 days in a week at the office)
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Good access to public transports

Title: Senior Data Analyst Regulatory Data Management
Description:
About The Team


CCCO Central is a transversal CIB team based in Paris and Lisbon and is part of the CIB functions.
CCCO Central acts, on behalf of the CIB CCCO (‚ÄúCIB Chief Conduct and Control Officer‚Äù) as a liaison between the second lines of defense (RISK ORM and Compliance) and the regional and business lines CCCOs of CIB in all their projects in regards with the management of non-financial risk (including regulatory, compliance, business process, conduct, etc.)
CCCO Central ensure that (i) CIB controls regulatory objectives are met, (ii) Permanent Control and Group policy impacts are properly coordinated and guided, (iii) CIB implication in Supervisory affairs is properly monitored and (iv) transversal initiatives are fully reviewed in light of permanent control.


About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNPParibas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor's degree in Information Technology and Computer Science or other related areas
2 years minimum relevant professional experience in Data Analytics
English fluent
Proficient in Tableau, Power BI and SQL server
Proficient in IT - Business - IT relationship
Strong analytical skills (Ability to synthetize and understand complex projects or processes
Advanced knowledge of data management (data integrity, consistency, ownership, ‚Ä¶)
Ability to develop and adapt a process
Strong communication skills, written and spoken
Highly organized and with the ability to multi-task
Rigorous and autonomous
Results driven - delivers high quality, and high impact work
Ability to analyze issues and prioritize based on potential impact
Team player with high ethics


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Quantitative Backtesting Analyst
Description:
Want to be part of the change?

Then, you‚Äôre in the right place. Our ambition is to build a sustainable future for our clients and our teams‚Ä¶ But we can‚Äôt do that without you!

By joining our Group, take part in our great transformation towards building a more sustainable world: we are committed to promoting access to more responsible and sustainable consumption to support our customers and partners.

To achieve this, we implement concrete actions, not only in the way we develop our business and enhance our sustainable growth, with the ambition to reduce our environmental footprint, but also in the way we support those who need it most.

Quantitative Backtesting Analyst

In concrete terms, your daily life

The Scoring Center team has a key role to play in the development of a strong risk management framework for BNP Paribas Personal Finance. As a prominent international banking institution and a leader in the Eurozone, BNP Paribas is relying on internal models to assess risks arising from its business activities. In this context, BNP Paribas is subject to stringent regulatory requirements on the assessment of the performance of internal rating and risk estimation systems.

Role

In this role, your primary responsibility will be to conduct backtesting activities focused on credit risk models, i.e. testing the predictive capacity of the models on historical data. Your mail activities will be:


Contribute to the production of Personal Finance regulatory backtesting on PD (Probability of Default), EAD/CCF (Exposure At Default) and LGD (Loss given default) risk IRBA models and parameters
Implement, maintain and run the Personal Finance backtesting on PD (Probability of Default) and LGD (Loss given default) IFRS9 risk models
Contribute to the production of the backtesting reports
Contribute to the production of specific analysis when required
Contribute to the production of the backtesting Synthesis for the Entities and for Central Risk
Participate in transversal projects related to credit risk models performance assessment
Contribute to the continuous improvement of existing tools and processes
Interact with the model owners, with the model developers and the management
Ensure adequate documentation in line with Group documentation standards


Missions are important, but the team and the work environment too!

Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, by joining the RISK department at BNP Paribas Portugal, you will be part of a dynamic, talented and expert team, with a global coverage. You will be able to develop your knowledge through career development plan and internal mobility.

Scoring Centre team is responsible for the relevance of risk rating models used within all local entities and for maintaining a high level of expertise with integrating new statistical techniques in new modelling environments. The Scoring Centre is a multi-cultural team of 40 people having various experiences and careers.

You operate in a friendly environment designed to make the collaborating experience as pleasant as possible and you will be welcomed upon your arrival by an integration course, on-the-job training and networking.

What do we have to offer you?

This is a very important topic that we‚Äôll discuss together, based on your specific experience and education.

For Now, We Highlight The Following Benefits


benefit+: package that considers benefits in areas such as protection, education and well-being, and which always includes Health Insurance, extendable to your family, and Life Insurance
Personal Credit to employees, under advantageous conditions compared to the market
Extra vacation days depending on seniority and volunteering
Smart working policy
Partnerships with various entities that give access to some advantages (tourism, food, hospitality, fashion, technology...


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs Degree in Mathematics and Statistics
At least 2 years of relevant experience
Fluent in English, both written and oral are mandatory
Strong analytical skills
Team player
Mandatory technical skills
Knowledge in data intelligence (data exploration, data preparation and data visualization)
Statistical analysis using Python (SAS is a plus)
Knowledge of risk management principles and IFRS9 / Basel regulation is a plus
Ability to communicate with the management


Our commitments

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices.

To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization.

What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year;
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)";
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available;
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand.

Title: Data Engineer - Looker Analytics
Description:
MAIN PURPOSE

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Analytics Engineer to join our growing data engineering team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success in designing, developing, and maintaining Looker dashboards and explores. This role requires a deep understanding of Looker's capabilities and a strong ability to translate complex business requirements into effective data visualizations. Experience with BigQuery and dbt is a plus.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain Looker dashboards, explores, and data models to meet the evolving needs of the business.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Develop and maintain Looker data models, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and performance.
Write efficient and well-documented LookML code.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Looker dashboards and explores.
Contribute to the ongoing improvement of our Looker platform and processes.
Work closely with other members of the data engineering team to ensure data quality and consistency.
Proactively identify and address potential performance bottlenecks in Looker.
Stay up-to-date with the latest Looker features and best practices.
Manage code using Git version control, including branching, merging, and pull requests.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of hands-on experience with Looker, including designing and developing dashboards and explores.
Proven ability to translate complex business requirements into effective data visualizations.
Strong understanding of data warehousing principles and best practices.
Experience with BigQuery and dbt is a plus.
Experience with Git version control systems (e.g., GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Key Looker Expertise Requirements


Extensive experience in LookML development, including creating custom visualizations and calculations.
Deep understanding of Looker's data modeling capabilities, including joins, aggregations, and calculated fields.
Experience with Looker's security and access control features.
Proficiency in using Looker's explore functionality to perform ad-hoc data analysis.
Experience with Looker's scheduling and alerting features.
Experience optimizing Looker dashboards and explores for performance.
Experience with Looker's API and integrations with other tools.


Show more
HTML:
MAIN PURPOSE

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Analytics Engineer to join our growing data engineering team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success in designing, developing, and maintaining Looker dashboards and explores. This role requires a deep understanding of Looker's capabilities and a strong ability to translate complex business requirements into effective data visualizations. Experience with BigQuery and dbt is a plus.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain Looker dashboards, explores, and data models to meet the evolving needs of the business.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
  • Develop and maintain Looker data models, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and performance.
  • Write efficient and well-documented LookML code.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Looker dashboards and explores.
  • Contribute to the ongoing improvement of our Looker platform and processes.
  • Work closely with other members of the data engineering team to ensure data quality and consistency.
  • Proactively identify and address potential performance bottlenecks in Looker.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest Looker features and best practices.
  • Manage code using Git version control, including branching, merging, and pull requests.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience with Looker, including designing and developing dashboards and explores.
  • Proven ability to translate complex business requirements into effective data visualizations.
  • Strong understanding of data warehousing principles and best practices.
  • Experience with BigQuery and dbt is a plus.
  • Experience with Git version control systems (e.g., GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket).
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Key Looker Expertise Requirements

  • Extensive experience in LookML development, including creating custom visualizations and calculations.
  • Deep understanding of Looker's data modeling capabilities, including joins, aggregations, and calculated fields.
  • Experience with Looker's security and access control features.
  • Proficiency in using Looker's explore functionality to perform ad-hoc data analysis.
  • Experience with Looker's scheduling and alerting features.
  • Experience optimizing Looker dashboards and explores for performance.
  • Experience with Looker's API and integrations with other tools.

Title: EU Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: EU Data Analyst




Location: Hybrid, Lisbon




Salary: Competitive + Benefits!







Join one of Europe's largest B2B used vehicle service




At BCA, we‚Äôre altogether, more. More than just your average vehicle remarketing company. More than just any other place to work. We‚Äôre Europe's largest vehicle remarketing business, the backbone of the automotive supply chain.




The BCA EU business is now at an exciting turning point in their ambitions for how data can enhance their customer proposition. This role is part of a significant investment in strengthen the Decision Intelligence capability in the EU business, through a continuous development and maintenance of the Data Warehouse, expanding our use of Data Science & Machine learning solutions, developing new dashboards and fostering the adoption of these tools by the business users, promoting efficiencies and generating added value.







Role Accountabilities:




Develop proofs of concept to illustrate how a business request/ need might be addressed, through the usage of the relevant data sources, applying the necessary data transformations and constituting PowerBI reports
Perform the adequate data transformation and analysis to deliver ad-hoc requests from the business areas, accessing data from the data warehouse or other available sources and building the final data deliverable
Work together with the other EU analysts to develop understanding of what new data capabilities will deliver the highest returns for the several business teams including:
Develop specification of the new data integration / reports / data science models would be required & document within DevOps system
Work with relevant reporting / data warehouse / data science teams
Present finished output to users and collate their feedback for any required updates
Explain the implications of analytical outcomes to business stakeholders in an easy-to-understand way, and help them understand the changes required to the business processes to drive improvements in business results
Proactive identification of new opportunities to leverage data for business advantage in the several business functions
Work with the BCA reporting team to create simple to understand reporting dashboards to enable effective operations usage of analytical outputs







Knowledge and Experience:




Extensive expertise in using data to drive improvements in several business functions
Desirable knowledge of automotive market and relevant industry metrics
Experience of using SQL to extract and transform data from data warehouses
Experience of building reports and dashboards in PowerBI and / or other tools
Advanced use of Excel and PowerPoint to report data to stakeholders
Previous usage of R and/ or Python to analyse data would be beneficial (but not required)
Management of backlogs using DevOps or other Kanban board tool







Our policy is to employ the best qualified people and provide equal opportunity for the advancement of employees including promotion and training and not to discriminate against any person because of gender, race, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion, belief or disability.







Thank you for your interest in working for us. Unfortunately, due to the volume of responses we cannot reply to every applicant, if you haven't heard from us in two weeks please assume you have not been successful.

Title: Data Analyst - Europe
Description:
Job Type

Permanent

Build a brilliant future with Hiscox

About Us

Hiscox is an international insurer specializing in luxury goods & property markets, as well as high-end professional insurance. As experts in risk, we empower individuals and businesses to achieve their ambitions. With offices in 9 European countries, we boast a highly international workforce, fostering a culture of inclusion, collaboration, and personal and professional growth.

Our Lisbon office is home to approximately 500 exceptional professionals representing 29 diverse nationalities. Located in the heart of the city, we emphasize a healthy work-life balance, offering a 35-hour workweek and a hybrid working model.

The Role

The Data Analyst is a role in the Europe Data Team who is responsible for the analysis of both business requirements and data available within our European analytics platform, which collects data from several sources ‚Äì and it is based on Microsoft Azure technologies.

The focus of this role is to analyse data and business requirements from a functional perspective, supporting European business and data teams in the clarification of requirements, identification of improvements and the definition of the evolution path and guidelines for the analytical platform, aligned with the overall Europe Data Strategy.

This role is part of functional/business analytical process and will support the technical team in the solution definition to achieve the delivery of consistent and accurate data and insights to various business teams (Sales, Underwriting, Finance, etc.). Therefore, this role requires someone who should be equally comfortable with functional and data analysis (including data visualisation tools), while dealing directly with a diverse audience.

Considering the strategic Data journey we are going through in Europe, there is the opportunity to shape the path and deliver the outcome. There is also the need for you to contribute and work with the team in delivering our current commitments, so business as usual is part of this role.

What does a Data Analyst do?

A Data Analyst is someone responsible for analysing business requirements and data available within our Europe Data Platform. A Data Analyst should be able to analyse data and produce insights to a varied client base, at the same time supporting the data team in delivering new analytical components and ensuring current commitments.

Main Activities For This Role Should Be


Business requirements analysis
Data analysis and discovery
Support data modelling and mapping activities to ensure business rules‚Äô configuration
Data extraction to support business ad-hoc requests
Monitor analytical platform results
Ensure the data is correctly collected from the different sources



Technical must-haves


Bachelor‚Äôs / Master‚Äôs degree, ideally in Management / Computer Science / Mathematic / Economics / Statistics (or similar)
Solid background in functional analysis, ideally in insurance business (min. of 2-3 years)
Ability to understand business needs and translate them to technical requirements
Experience in Business Intelligence / Data & Analytics roles (min. of 2-3 years)
Knowledge of SQL and analytical/reporting tools (e.g. Power BI), required to perform data analysis
Fluent in English, verbally and written



Personality trades


Motivated self-starter who can work autonomously and add value in a team
Passionate with a can-do attitude, looking forward to unlocking the value that exists within our data
Thirst for new ways of working to add value to the business
Ability to sell ideas and concepts providing background knowledge and information to the team as well as internal customers
Ability to link business needs to technical deliveries
Customer relationship management ‚Äì ability to build productive relationships with end users and deliver robust solutions to them
Business focused
Ability to work with ambiguity and change
Flexibility in both attitude and delivery style
Resilience



Nice to haves


Experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence and Analytics tools
Experience with Agile/Scrum based methodologies
Experience in the Financial Services sector



Why Hiscox?

At Hiscox, We Believe In Creating An Environment Where Our People Can Thrive - Both Professionally And Personally. Here's What We Offer


Work-Life Balance: Enjoy a 35 hours work week and a hybrid model designed for flexibility.
Holidays: 25 days + 2 Hiscox Days (Extra two Annual Leave).
Comprehensive Benefits: Health insurance for you and your family, Life Insurance, a pension plan, sports allowance and access to mental health support.
Sabbatical Program: Every 5 years, take a fully paid 1-month sabbatical on top of your holidays.
Team Spirit: Be part of a collaborative and inclusive cultural with opportunities to engage in local and international initiatives



Work with amazing people and be part of a unique culture

Title: Data Driven | Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

Are you passionate about data analysis and visualization? We have an exciting opportunity for a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data-Driven Intelligence team.

Creation of reports/dashboards where information is easily available to users for direct consumption and presented in a user-friendly way
Creating analytical capabilities, exploring and extracting knowledge from data.


Qualifications


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Experience with Data visualization tool (preferably Power BI and/or Tableau)
Proficiency in SQL
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.
