Title: Data Analyst (Hybrid)
HTML:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it‚Äôs all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us ‚Äì growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.

For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!

Join our team of 160+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.

Your Mission Will Be

  • Collaborate with stakeholders from different sectors to identify and understand their specific analytical needs and challenges;
  • Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for improvement and customization;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI to provide actionable insights;
  • Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.

You Will Need

  • Minimum of 2 years experience in data analysis;
  • Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
  • Ability to translate business needs into technical specifications;
  • Fluency in Portuguese and English (other languages are a plus);
  • CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.

Would Be Awesome If You Have

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
  • Experience in query languages such as SQL;
  • Familiarity with business intelligence principles and data management practices.

With Us You Can Be a

  • TechThinker ‚Äì people who want to re-imagine technology with us
  • TechSolver ‚Äì strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
  • InnoMinder ‚Äì inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
  • InnoTecher ‚Äì no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!

Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, Global Client Analytics, Quantitative Data Intelligence, Python, SQL, GIT, Optimization

Your Main Activities Are


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends throught what data can tell
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understading their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving skills
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stekeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders
You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges


Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Professional experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analyze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus


About The Team


The Quantitative Data Intelligence (QDI) team is responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office.
The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.
Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.
We seek to shape the technologies available to the client‚Äôs needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ComparaJ√°.pt

ComparaJ√°.pt is a free and independent online comparison platform for financial services and products, with a clear mission: to help people saving time and money, in a quick and simple comparison tool.

Our goal is for Portuguese consumers to make informed and conscious financial decisions. For this, we provide a free, impartial, thorough and independent platform, where people can compare the various financial providers in the Portuguese market for home loans, personal loans, credit cards, telecommunication and energy providers, life insurance and saving accounts.

We are the #1 personal finance platform in Portugal for the users, our partners and media channels. We are part of Samlino Group, a European Investment Company that helps Europeans save time and money by making better choices about insurance, home services and banking products. In Europe, our sister companies are: Samlino.dk (Denmark), VertaaEnsin.fi (Finland), TopCompare.be & Tariefchecker.be (Belgium), and Pricefox.gr (Greece).

What You'll Do


You will support expansion and daily operations, analyzing marketing trends and participating in strategic projects.
You will be responsible and have full ownership of analytical work, with direct reporting to one of our Managing Directors.
You will collaborate with the different Marketing Teams (SEO, PR, paid social, Search), Product and Operational teams, being the point of contact for the key projects you are leading.
You will cooperate within a multicultural and multidisciplinary team developing and improving processes, with direct contact with the Group leadership team in London.


What We Expect from you

You possess an unparalleled work ethic with a high sense of urgency. You have a relentless drive and desire to be the very best at what you do. You take ownership of everything you do, are proactive and follow through on commitments. Moreover, you're humble and you share our passion for building and executing new businesses. Furthermore, we expect that you:


Have acquired a bachelor or master's degree with outstanding results in Management, Marketing, Economics, Finance or another related field. Financial knowledge is a plus.
You are knowledgeable in MS Office and analytical tools. SQL knowledge is a plus.
You have a strong sense of ownership and initiative and a genuine interest in learning and act on the desire.
You have a strong affinity for critical thinking, analytical, hands-on execution, problem-solving, and result-orientation.
You have an EU work permit.
Plus: You are passionate about Marketing and Management, with a taste for Finance.


What We Offer


A workplace with great talents and leaders that will inspire and challenge you daily.
Responsibility for high impact projects that constantly push you out of your comfort zone and give you the opportunity to be the best you can.
Competitive compensation and benefits.
Assume responsibility and decision-making authority from your first day.
Work on exciting and challenging projects and create an impact with new, innovative ideas.
Grow personally and professionally from working both independently and as part of an international group.
Work with and learn from experts and mentors in diverse fields.
Create strong and meaningful connections with your team members at exciting company events.
Be part of one of the most promising Portuguese fintech startups, with one goal in mind: help the Portuguese people saving money.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Product

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Lisbon

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale‚Äôs use Tabby‚Äôs technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

You‚Äôll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:


Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:


3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.
Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.
Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data ‚Äî extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.
Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple‚Äôs ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google‚Äôs Privacy Sandbox.
Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Fluency in English.



Job Benefits:


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
Health Insurance.



Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:


Flight to one of the mentioned countries.
Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.
Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.
Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Product

Location: Remote/Lisbon



Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 5,000,000 active users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.
Over 30,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, H&M, Adidas, IKEA, SHEIN, noon, and Bloomingdale's use Tabby's technology to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering flexible payments online and in stores. Tabby is active in Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt and Kuwait and backed by leading investors, including Sequoia Capital India, STV, PayPal Ventures, Mubadala Investment Capital, Arbor Ventures and others.

We are looking for a Marketing Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing team and help us evaluate marketing efficiency and find the best way to acquire new and reactivate existing users, playing a pivotal role in launching and optimizing marketing strategies that drive meaningful impact. You'll collaborate closely with Analysts, Marketing, and Product teams.

You‚Äôll be working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving environment with the following responsibilities:




Provide analytical support to the Marketing and Product Marketing teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer. acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.


Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly to highlight the importance of your insights.


Support and monitor existing performance marketing metrics, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.


Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.


Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.




Skills, Knowledge & Expertise:





3+ years of experience as a data/marketing analyst.


Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.


Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.


Proficiency in digital marketing platforms from Meta and Google.


Strong understanding of mobile attribution and MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, etc.), including event tracking, postbacks, and troubleshooting.


Experience working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data ‚Äî extracting, decoding, and analyzing postbacks to optimize iOS campaigns.


Knowledge of privacy-first attribution frameworks like Apple's ATT, Meta's AEM, and Google's Privacy Sandbox.


Experience with marketing attribution platforms is a plus.


Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.


Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests is a plus.


Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.


Fluency in English.










Job Benefits:




We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.


A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.


You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.


Participation in company's employee stock options program.


Health Insurance.



Relocation

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia/Georgia/Serbia/Portugal/Spain.

We will help you open a legal entity and a bank account. In Armenia and Georgia the taxes are compensated by Tabby. In other countries we provide partial compensation of taxes.

We employ according to B2B contracts (service agreements).

For our employees we cover the following:



Flight to one of the mentioned countries.


Accommodation during the paperwork completion period.


Opening a bank account and getting a residence permit in one of the mentioned countries.


Family relocation (dependants).



New employees can also choose an alternative method of relocation to another country of their choice. In this case, Tabby will reimburse up to $5,000 of verified costs upon opening a legal entity and a bank account.

We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
LOCATION - Lisbon, Portugal

HOURS - 40 hours

About The Role -

We have an incredible opportunity for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our SDO Team. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for performing day-to-day Reporting & Analytics operations. This position involves collaborating with various departments, support Finance Business Partners and Group FP&A with preparing financial plan / rolling forecast and standard entity level management reports and providing insights to contribute to strategic decision-making within the organization.

WHAT WILL YOU BE RESPONSIBLE FOR?


Engage in learning and development activities, seeking guidance from senior and team lead
Actively participate in functional and technical training related to ERP Systems, consolidation and management reporting tools to enhance knowledge
Organize and clean up data in forecasting tool to be utilized by Group FP&A and Finance Business Partners in preparation of rolling forecast
Perform analysis of data in forecasting tool and determine clarifications required
Support in analyzing simple variances and communicate with Finance Business Partners and key stakeholders on the explanations and insights
Ensure the first draft of financial plan / rolling forecast is ready in a forecasting tool for FBPs and Group FP&A teams
Support Group FP&A in further ad-hoc tasks required for financial plan / rolling forecast preparation
Prepare standardized management reporting on the entity level
Support in obtaining timely sign-offs on management reports and forecasted data
Collaborate with Group FP&A, Finance Business Partners and operational teams to ensure alignment of financial plans with business strategies
Proactively raise issues/concerns if any which can impact the performance of activities within timelines


WHAT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WILL BE REQUIRED?


Total relevant FP&A and management reporting experience of 1-2 Years
Knowledge of finance forecasting and management reporting activities
Understanding of financial modeling and data analysis
Strong Excel, analytical and quantitative skills
Familiarity with financial forecasting software and ERP systems (preferably SAP S/4 HANA)
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment
Strong communication skills and attention to details


WHAT IS ON OFFER?

As a colleague at Scandinavian Tobacco Group, you will receive a comprehensive compensation package. Our benefits differ across regions; our recruiting team will be able to give more details.

OUR HIRING PROCESS

Requirements

Before we enter a hiring process, your job application will be reviewed by a member of our recruiting team. Your application will be reviewed in line with the hiring competencies we have for the role you have applied for. If your experience aligns with the requirements, you will enter our hiring process which will consist of the following:


Recruiter Screen
Hiring Manager Interview
Behavioral Assessment
Leadership Interview


About Scandinavian Tobacco Group

At Scandinavian Tobacco Group, we always encourage you to craft the career that makes you more. We have a rich heritage that dates back 250 years and have been operating as a Scandinavian Tobacco Group since 1961. We operate in over 100 countries, employing over 10,000 people. We offer a diverse portfolio of iconic brands ranging from Signature, Cohiba, Macanudo, CAO, Partagas and most recently branched into smokeless tobacco through our recent acquisition of XQS. We are on a mission to focus on sustainability and minimizing our environmental footprint. We are committed to creating a culture that allows us to blend our strengths, to go far it takes a winning team, and this is why we pride ourselves on sharing our skills, knowledge and expertise to push each other forward.

Scandinavian Tobacco Group Talent Team

Scandinavian Tobacco Group is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will

receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual

orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any

other characteristic protected by law.

Please be informed that this Direct Search is conducted exclusively by Scandinavian Tobacco Group. We do not accept applications from agencies, and we will not provide compensation for unsolicited CVs.

Title: Analytics Specialist
HTML:
Boost IT is a Portuguese technology consultancy company, we are integrated into one of the most entrepreneurial groups in Portugal, with investment in more than 30 companies.

We want to be known for being the most dynamic, energetic and reliable company to operate in the market and, for that, we want to count on you.

If you're passionate about technology and want to work on the most relevant technology projects, then this ad could be for you!


Responsibilities:

¬∑ Develop the analytics and data platform vision and roadmap for the business, while ensuring day-to-day delivery and performance

¬∑ Develop the strategy for collecting, manipulating, and analyzing data for all departments such as Marketing, Product, Operations, and Customer Experience

¬∑ Develop a data culture and community across the organization to share best practices, champion the use of data, and continuously improve our focus on outcomes and user experience

¬∑ Build strong relationships with and educate team leaders on how to use data in their environments and leverage insights to drive improved business outcomes

¬∑ Partner with teams to track market trends, user behavior, and business performance through the development of dashboards, hypotheses, and related experiments

¬∑ Support the development and collection of both qualitative and quantitative insights

Requirements:

¬∑ 2+ years of related work experience;

¬∑ Degree in Marketing & Communication, Mathematics, Statistics, Management or a related technical field

¬∑ Expert experience with Google Analytics 360 and Google Tag Manager required ‚Äì analysis and implementation;

¬∑ Experience with Data Layer configurations (Enhanced e-commerce set-up, events, etc.)

¬∑ Experience with creating effective data visualizations with Google Looker Studio (Power BI and other tools are a plus);

¬∑ Technical expertise in data models and database design and development;

¬∑ Working knowledge of HTML, JavaScript, and Web debugging tools;

¬∑ Experience with SQL, Microsoft Excel, Big Query, and Google Cloud Platform;

¬∑ Ability to understand and analyze data sets required for machine learning and AI algorithms is a plus;

¬∑ Strong analytical and critical thinking skills;

¬∑ Experience with A/B Testing;

¬∑ Be creative, proactive, logical, and innovative;

¬∑ Be highly results-oriented, a self-learner, and have the energy and determination to succeed in a fast-paced, fun, and entrepreneurial environment;

¬∑ Ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously with excellence;

¬∑ Excellent written and verbal communication skills, both in Portuguese and English, able to work with people at all levels inside and outside the company and explain findings.


Benefits

22 days of annual vacation leave (+ 3 additional days on us! - Birthday, Christmas Eve, and New Year's Eve)

Hybrid work arrangement- 2 days a week on-site in Parque das Na√ß√µes

Career progression opportunities

Health insurance

Teambuilding activities



Boost IT. Doing IT. Better

Title: Capabilities & Insights Analyst ‚Äì Data & Analytics
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You'll be based in our Lisbon, Portugal office. You'll be part of Digital and Technology CCN team.

Digital & Tech CCN brings together the best of McKinsey‚Äôs digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses. Colleagues in our global Client Capabilities Network deliver distinctive client impact through assets and expertise and are driven by a culture of innovation. You‚Äôll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to Agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. You‚Äôll typically work on data transformation projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.

You‚Äôll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-tech topics. Digital & Tech CCN has multiple Center of Competence (CoC) with members in each CoC supporting various service lines to bring deep subject matter expertise strengthening our client value proposition and delivery.

The Data & Analytics Transformation Center of Competence (CoC) is one such capability which supports multiple topics including Data & Analytics. The CoC serves as a global knowledge hub of expertise that owns, maintains, and deploys key proprietary knowledge assets. The CoC serves clients across the end-to-end data value chain, across each category (e.g., Data & Analytics (including AI, GenAI, etc.) Strategy & Use Case, Data Architecture, Data Governance & Operating Model, and Talent & Culture).

When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

What You'll Do

You will serve clients by providing primary research support to consultants in various data and analytics-related topics. Additionally, you will work on client engagements, as part of the client service team, by bringing expertise to workstreams or by delivering our data & analytics tools and assets.

In this role, you will outline and problem-solve with client project teams on their research requirements. You will clarify request objectives and determine the most appropriate, cost-effective, and timely research/analytics approaches. Additionally, you will conduct in-depth research using relevant, qualified resources (e.g., proprietary, and external databases, analyst reports, and expert interviews) and provide the relevant and most up-to-date information.

In parallel, you will support the global data & analytics practice leadership to build out the firm's capabilities with the creation or maintenance of assets and client events (e.g., Global benchmarks, Global Data & AI summits, etc.) to tackle client‚Äôs challenges to become a cornerstone of the global core leadership team for our Data & Analytics practice.

As you progress in your journey at the firm, you will have an opportunity to build and own assets that help accelerate our client delivery while also building expertise in one of the cutting-edge technology topics such as GenAI implementation, Data & Analytics strategy, Data on Cloud, Data Architecture, Data Engineering, Data Ops, ML Ops, Data Products and Operating Model to help our clients realize the value from data to transform their business.

You will work a hybrid home/office model and travel for events, client projects, and team connectivity events.

Qualifications


Master's degree in IT/computer science, data science, engineering, physics, mathematics, electronics or equivalent
2+ years of relevant experience in enterprise data architecture, data management processes or technology, data engineering or data science is a plus
General understanding and interest for digital/business technology
Proficiency in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and relevant analytics/statistical packages
Experience or knowledge of programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, PHP, Java, JS, C, C++, etc.) and relevant tools e.g., data visualization, data analytics, data catalog, etc.) or cloud providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCS, etc.) is a plus
Team player with highly professional customer service orientation
Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Show more
HTML:
Who You'll Work With

You'll be based in our Lisbon, Portugal office. You'll be part of Digital and Technology CCN team.

Digital & Tech CCN brings together the best of McKinsey‚Äôs digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses. Colleagues in our global Client Capabilities Network deliver distinctive client impact through assets and expertise and are driven by a culture of innovation. You‚Äôll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to Agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. You‚Äôll typically work on data transformation projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.

You‚Äôll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-tech topics. Digital & Tech CCN has multiple Center of Competence (CoC) with members in each CoC supporting various service lines to bring deep subject matter expertise strengthening our client value proposition and delivery.

The Data & Analytics Transformation Center of Competence (CoC) is one such capability which supports multiple topics including Data & Analytics. The CoC serves as a global knowledge hub of expertise that owns, maintains, and deploys key proprietary knowledge assets. The CoC serves clients across the end-to-end data value chain, across each category (e.g., Data & Analytics (including AI, GenAI, etc.) Strategy & Use Case, Data Architecture, Data Governance & Operating Model, and Talent & Culture).

When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

What You'll Do

You will serve clients by providing primary research support to consultants in various data and analytics-related topics. Additionally, you will work on client engagements, as part of the client service team, by bringing expertise to workstreams or by delivering our data & analytics tools and assets.

In this role, you will outline and problem-solve with client project teams on their research requirements. You will clarify request objectives and determine the most appropriate, cost-effective, and timely research/analytics approaches. Additionally, you will conduct in-depth research using relevant, qualified resources (e.g., proprietary, and external databases, analyst reports, and expert interviews) and provide the relevant and most up-to-date information.

In parallel, you will support the global data & analytics practice leadership to build out the firm's capabilities with the creation or maintenance of assets and client events (e.g., Global benchmarks, Global Data & AI summits, etc.) to tackle client‚Äôs challenges to become a cornerstone of the global core leadership team for our Data & Analytics practice.

As you progress in your journey at the firm, you will have an opportunity to build and own assets that help accelerate our client delivery while also building expertise in one of the cutting-edge technology topics such as GenAI implementation, Data & Analytics strategy, Data on Cloud, Data Architecture, Data Engineering, Data Ops, ML Ops, Data Products and Operating Model to help our clients realize the value from data to transform their business.

You will work a hybrid home/office model and travel for events, client projects, and team connectivity events.

Qualifications

  • Master's degree in IT/computer science, data science, engineering, physics, mathematics, electronics or equivalent
  • 2+ years of relevant experience in enterprise data architecture, data management processes or technology, data engineering or data science is a plus
  • General understanding and interest for digital/business technology
  • Proficiency in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and relevant analytics/statistical packages
  • Experience or knowledge of programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python, PHP, Java, JS, C, C++, etc.) and relevant tools e.g., data visualization, data analytics, data catalog, etc.) or cloud providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCS, etc.) is a plus
  • Team player with highly professional customer service orientation
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Semasio (a Samba TV Company) is a dynamic global company with access to the world's most progressive audiences and the most comprehensive contextual platform available. Our industry-leading advertising solutions are trusted by Fortune 500 companies and emerging brands to increase reach, boost efficiency, and maximize ROI.¬†Our team is global, located in the US, UK, Portugal, Germany and Denmark. We remain tight-knit across time zones through open communication and consistent collaboration. We care about cultivating an inclusive, approachable and ambitious culture while having fun along the way. We believe diversity fosters creativity, innovation and a sense of community.¬†Join us in our mission to lead the privacy-first performance revolution. If this sparks curiosity, then read on!

Semasio is a Unified Targeting provider that enables digital marketers to reach their target audience by seamlessly combining Audience and Contextual targeting. Our clients are leading global media agencies, brands and publishers, and we operate globally within the NAM, EMEA and APAC regions.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst- Solutions to join our dynamic team. This role will play a pivotal role in ensuring the successful implementation, optimization, and ongoing support of our ad tech solutions for clients across the EMEA, APAC, and NAM regions. This position requires a strong understanding of advertising technology, exceptional data analytics skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.




Day to Day:
Taxonomy Development and Optimization: Create accurate, scalable taxonomies and optimize Always-On offerings across markets for performance and reach.
Client Support and Relationship Management: Serve as the primary technical support contact for EMEA clients, including media agencies, trading desks, publishers, and advertisers. Build strong client relationships and provide training on the Semantic Targeting Platform.
Partner Collaboration and Platform Optimization: Collaborate with partners to clean up, deprecate, or enhance taxonomies. Maintain and optimize internal SaaS platforms and advise on external platforms like DSPs, SSPs, and Curate.
Data and Marketing Alignment: Act as a bridge between Data and Marketing teams to promote best-in-class segments and support seasonal and Always-On targets.
Market Analysis and Strategy: Conduct competitive and trend analyses, ensuring CPM competitiveness and proposing new strategies with partners, agencies, and sales.
Technical Assurance and Custom Solutions: Maintain technical stability, troubleshoot issues with Product and Engineering teams, and develop white-labeled partner solutions.
Innovation and Differentiation: Ensure data discoverability, understand data interactions with partner algorithms, and recommend tailored solutions to optimize advertising campaigns.
Reporting and Continuous Improvement: Collaborate on reporting and analysis to drive global optimization and platform enhancements.




Preferred Exerience:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Marketing, or related field
3-5 years of Technical Account, Data Analysis experience preferably in consulting and managing complex software solutions
Strong technical background with expertise in ad-serving platforms, programmatic advertising, data management platforms (DMPs), and related technologies
Experience or interest in the online marketing industry
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills and¬† ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences effectively
Team player with a hands-on mentality and drive to learn and understand new topics
Sales and relationship-building skills¬†
Have an affinity for complex technical processes and tools
Offer a hands-on mentality and have the eagerness to understand new topics
Ideally, have gained first experiences in data-driven marketing or programmatic advertising
Speak and write English fluently







Semasio (a Samba TV company) is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.¬†¬†We strive to empower connection with one another, reflect the communities we serve, and tackle meaningful projects that make a real impact.

Samba TV may collect personal information directly from you, as a job applicant, Samba TV may also receive personal information from third parties, for example, in connection with a background, employment or reference check, in accordance with the applicable law.¬†For further details, please see Samba's¬†Applicant Privacy Policy.¬†For residents of the EU, Samba Inc. is the data controller.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

‚Ä¢ BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

‚Ä¢ Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Experience in Alteryx and VBA;

‚Ä¢ Power BI Experience;

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of SQL (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;

‚Ä¢ Fluent English (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek üöÄ, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe üåé supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




üáµüáπ Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center ‚Äì Sodexo Business Services ‚Äì SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several üìäüßæFinancial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







üí• Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




üíº We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




‚öô What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




ü§ô What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master‚Äôs degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.




üéâ What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee‚Äôs birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team¬¥s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that¬¥s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal and external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholder


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in Information Technology and Computer Science, or Mathematics and Statistics
Up to 2 years of professional experience in data analytics
Proficiency in Data Viz Blending Analytics (Tableau and Power BI) as well as Database Management Microsoft SQL Server
Fluent in English, oral and written
Good communication skills
Analytical
Capable of synthetize and simplify
Able to deliver and results driven


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst (HYBRID @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: +3 years

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week in Porto)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics or Mathematics;
3+ years of experience as Data Analyst;
Proficiency with ETL, SQL, PowerBI and Alteryx;
Experience with Jaspersoft, VBA, API, Python and Tibco Spotfire are nice to have;
Ability to perform database queries;
Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills;
Strong attention to detail and accuracy;
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Comfort speaking French.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Business Intelligence
Description:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.




What are we looking for?




Your text is clear and professional. Here's a slightly polished version to improve readability and consistency:
3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence.
Solid experience with Power BI, including a strong understanding of its architecture.
Proficiency in ETL processes, Data Warehousing development, and maintenance.
Experience in T-SQL, DAX, Power Query, PowerShell scripting, and Rest APIs.
Good knowledge of Microsoft technologies (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS).
Familiarity with Power Platform (Power Automate and Power Apps) and Microsoft tools is a plus.
Proficiency in English, with strong communication skills to present ideas clearly and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
French is a plus.
Residence in Porto (mandatory requirement).




What do we have to offer you?

Health Insurance;
Feedback&Coffee ‚Äì the system that includes Aubay‚Äôs Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
Working model: hybrid/remote/on-site;
A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
Events and Teambuildings.




What makes us different?

Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
Reference prizes and birthday present;
We don‚Äôt have a dress code;
We know your name and all address each other informally;
You will grow in good company.Isn‚Äôt this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?




If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you!




We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.

We are a Portuguese technology consulting company with a strong outward look to the rest of Europe. We have 10 years of experience in the market and reached the status of ‚Äúlarge company‚Äù in 2018. We now have more than 350 associates and we keep growing, with offices in Lisbon, Porto, and Leiria, as well as projects in more than 20 countries. Our company is part of the national top 10, with a growth of 250% in the last years.


Work-life balance is part of our DNA. We focus on win-win-win relationships, defining every moment of interaction as an experience with unique conditions. Working with Affinity is a ‚ÄúLifetime Experience‚Äù where you will have the opportunity to demonstrate all your potential and to be successful on every level.


#welcometoyourfuture


What you need to have/know:


  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
  • Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation
  • Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience with Alteryx.
  • Good Knowledge of SQL
  • Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory)


What we expect from you:


  • Will to exceed expectations (your own and the ones defined by Affinity);
  • Exceptional skills and the will to acquire more;
  • Good people skills (not just in terms of technology, language, and platforms), team spirit, and pleasant disposition;
  • Autonomy, proactivity, and focus (even under pressure);
  • Obsession for doing things right, and ability to prioritize;
  • Versatility (you can be a fan of BYOD or not);
  • Ability to innovate and evolve in a market in constant mutation.


What will encourage you


  • Being part of a company that has a disruptive action in the technology market;
  • Being part of a technology focused on relationships, simplicity, and efficiency;
  • Accessing a generative career directly proportional to your performance and interest;
  • The real possibility of being part of our company staff.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
DESCRIPTION

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be a pivotal member of our data-driven team, responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making across the organization. Collaborating closely with diverse departments such as Finance, Operations, Logistics, Marketing, and Product Engineering, you will gather requirements, develop analytical models, and deliver critical dashboards to monitor and enhance performance.

By leveraging your data handling capabilities, analytical acumen and data visualization skills, your insights will contribute directly to the company‚Äôs success and efficiency. This role is ideal for someone adaptable and eager to grow in a dynamic environment, bringing a strong business perspective and an innovative approach to problem-solving.




*Only applications submitted in English will be considered*.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop, implement, and maintain analytical models to support cross-functional reporting needs and daily monitoring of business KPIs.
Business Requirements: Collaborate with stakeholders from various departments to understand analytical requirements and translate them into actionable data insights.
Design, create, and optimize dashboards using data visualization tools such as Domo, Tableau, or Power BI for clear and impactful data presentation.
Interpret data trends and produce insights that inform and shape strategic and operational business decisions.
ETL Workflow Management: Build ETL workflows and data pipelines to ensure seamless integration and flow of data across systems.
Data Quality Assurance: Conduct data validation and quality assurance to maintain data integrity and reliability in all reports and dashboards.
Continuous Improvement in Data Practices: Stay informed on industry best practices and continually propose improvements to data practices and analytical approaches.
Ad-Hoc Reporting Support: Support ad-hoc reporting requests and contribute to ongoing projects with innovative analytical solutions.




REQUIREMENTS

Technical skills & qualifications

4+ years of experience in a similar role
Proficiency in SQL and solid experience with data modeling in BigQuery or similar database environments
Knowledge of ETL tools and data pipeline management
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Domo, Tableau, Power BI, or others
Knowledge of Python or a similar programming language used for data analysis and automation
Familiarity with cloud data platforms like Google Cloud Platform and Snowflake is preferred
Knowledge of Spark for big data processing is an advantage
Educational background in Economics, Business Management, Math, or Statistics is valued

People skills & traits

Analytical and detail-oriented with a natural ability to interpret and present data insights effectively
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive, self-driven approach to tasks
Excellent communication skills with the ability to understand and articulate business needs and technical information across departments
Flexibility and willingness to learn, adapt, and grow within a fast-paced environment
Proficiency in English




WHAT WE OFFER

The chance to have a meaningful and positive impact on roads and cities‚Äô safety
Flexibility - in schedule, work location, benefits
Competitive compensation
A fast-paced work environment full of kind, smart, and highly driven people
Great professional and personal growth opportunities
Regular team-building events and well-being initiatives/facilities




WHO WE ARE

Nexar is a Vision AI company that is organising the physical world as digital information. We are a global, connected, and intelligent network of mobile cameras on the road that uses data to deliver valuable insights and build transformative products in vehicle autonomy and safety.

Our goal is to be the best car camera service in the world, with a vast network of smart, connected cameras across the planet. We are unlocking the power of connected driving to protect our users and build a lasting business, and this is where you come in!

We‚Äôre looking for passionate, forward-thinking people to help us execute this incredible opportunity and drive the future of connected driving technology. Join us in shaping a safer, smarter world.

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Officer
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing ‚Ä¶) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up‚Ä¶)
Build a state of the art industrial ‚ÄúClient Intelligence‚Äù solutio
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills ‚Äì (IntermediateContribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst (Engineer)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üöÄ

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions


What You'll Need


5+ years of professional experience in an analytical role, creating impactful data-driven solutions
Excellent background/education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


An advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Excellent experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in Physics, Maths, Economics, or Programming


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.
